2obAyPuH-G3Dn3EUdQnQlA.review_text: great focaccia bread sanwiches. the grilled chicken #1 and #2 are excellent as well as the turkey and the combo. great location for north beach people watching, especially if you get a seat looking toward washington square.

AHz3sGxkZjAzv8uu0Q9hqg.review_text: I can't believe that I just realized that I hadn't drafted a review for Mario's!!!!  It must be all the drinking that I've been doing!!!  Some of which was actually done at Mario's.  This little joint is FULL of San Francisco character.    Are you from out of town and want a slice of North Beach?   Visit Mario's!  They have a slim alcohol list (beer and wine), but the food...oh the food...and the atmosphere.  There is a cast of regulars, as well as tourists that happen to stumble upon this little gem.  Oh...two words...focaccia...and panini...  Now talk amongst yerselves, dahlings!

cdNrjPMAXvqMd4O71dIcrw.review_text: Small, friendly, doesn't feel as touristy as some of the other places on Columbus (granted, I say this as a tourist).   We only had the cappucino (very good) and the biscotti (also good).

v25DMFAod5z3MEEh3uENJw.review_text: This place has really gone downhill! It used to be one of our favorite places when we lived in North Beach but now the service SUCKS!!! We had a horrendous experience last weekend. We got a eeat outside and the waitress kept coming outside but never came over to our table until about 20 minutes later.  She said she would bring us menus but 15 minutes later, we were still waiting (she came outside a bunch of times gave other people menus and took other people's orders but did not acknowledge us.  It was somewhat busy but at least come over and apologize.  I finally went inside and picked up 2 menus, on my way back saying to her nicely "you look busy, I dont mind getting the menus."  She just gave me a dirty look. Then we waited another 20 minutes to get our order taken and we were still waiting.  I finally went into the bartender and he said "we have table service."  I told him I knew but we were waiting over 30 minutes so can I just give him my order.   He basically barked at me in a nasty, loud voice "YOU ARE AT THAT TABLE OUTSIDE, YOU HAVE NOT BEEN HERE 30 MINUTES, THE MOST 5 MINUTES!"  I said calmly, no we have been waiting over 30 minutes, I know she is busy but can I just give you my order?"  He rudely said "WE WILL GET TO YOU WHEN WE CAN!"  I was FUMING but gave him back the menus and walked out.  Of course we left after that.   I worked as a barista, bartender and waitress and would never treat a customer that way, no matter how busy I am and especially if they were nice and respectful. The people that worked at Mario's last Saturday demonstrated the WORST service I have ever experienced.  They should be embarrassed.   Needless to say, we wont be going back. If I could give negative stars I would.

m5cBT7OYfn0HM0d-RCsdZQ.review_text: Perfect Late Spot  I have several friends.  Shopping friends. Complain-to friends. Driving friends (golf dudes, golf!) Intellectual/Art friends.  One of my good friends would fall under the Intellectual/Art friend since he is really the only one I can go out with to a lecture-a performance-an art show and feel that our intellectual percents totally vibe.  Basically, I think we are creative equivalents, and then he tops that off more by being tops in the technical department.  After a fantastic performance at the SFAI, we wandered over to North Beach for the habitual haunt of either coffee or something tasty to nibble on.  Since I've been on a roll with the gym and my butt looking better in my bikini, I was loathe to roll into Cafe Greco where my fave Tiramisu would be attempting to sabotage my intentions with a little love from behind the display.  We opted for Mario's.  We've been here a couple times before because they are open late, until 11:00.    My friend ordered the Chicken Panini and I ordered the standard Mario's green salad tossed with a balsamic vinegarette.  His panini came right out of the grill: hot, melted, gooey loveliness between two crunchy soft pieces of bread.  My salad hit the spot, a large round plate loaded with crisp Romaine, tomatoes and red onions.  I worked out earlier this morning AND walked 7 blocks in my 2 1/2 inch platform sandals, so two slices of French Bread took refuge in my stomach.  I love Mario's for the casual atmosphere and the typical corner where we could watch the people walk by enjoying this sudden turn of events regarding cold SF weather.  I wore a summer dress out and it was nice to have bare shoulders once in a while.  Inexpensive, good staff and hot little sandwiches to keep us intellectual junkies out on the road.

HPJGk8P98aM-MJkbNasNDA.review_text: This place is a great stop for lunch or a light dinner.  With one tiny oven and a panini press they manage to crank out some delicious sandwiches (I always get a half of chicken #2 and have never been disappointed).  Friendly service and really inexpensive (albeit mediocre) wines by the glass.

_DmZf8CUPgsuPdSnQcP4Ug.review_text: Is this the most amazing Italian food you've ever had? no. Is this most amazing service and experience in SF? Probably not. Is this the perfect place to perch on a warm Saturday afternoon, sipping house wine and people watching in the park while listening to mellow blues? YES!  On the edge of Washington square park and in the heart of North beach lies this little gem of a bar. Completely unpretentious and inviting, a two person operation on a busy holiday weekend still felt chill and relaxed. We ordered with our eyes (the caprese salad - which was surprisingly light given all the cheese and meat on the plate) and sipped on the 'house' white wine. The bar is comfortable and the staff is efficient. When I explain everything individually - it sounds like it's 'nothing special', but if you put all the elements into an equasion, it's perfect harmony and a great place to put your feet up for awhile and enjoy San Francisco.  Definitely recommend to tourists and locals.

i1IUqcMBd9DyEgkRoySCkQ.review_text: less than 5 stars?  really?  kick you in the shins and make you live in cleveland.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: The meatball sandwich was recommended by the 7x7 cheap eats.  The sandwich is pretty good but its more like a meatloaf versus a meatball.  Its a cool bar serving some decent sandwiches and pizza.

-p5Jz999bm9JjcMoCoJdmQ.review_text: North Beach is full of false havens but this place is legit- a pearl. The grilled foccacia sandos are unreal in their deliciousness. I can't say I have had it done better EVER. The lasagna is very good as well. The space is utterly classic and brimming with character without being kitschy or... well... dirty. It's a great place for a casual evening dinner that really knocks it out of the park with how tasty everything is. I also believe the owner does all the service so he is of course very attentive and wants to keep you happy which he does with ease. This will now be my go-to place to eat in North Beach.

RZqYPjZ-GGMwkAkO0nsnDg.review_text: A native San Franciscan took me here years ago, and I have been coming ever since. I usually order the toasted meatball or sausage  sandwich...the portions are are large and the price is reasonable for the City.  Today, I switched it up a little and ordered the hot pastrami which was absolutely fabulous!  If you are tired of having a boring sandwich, come here for the focaccia sandwiches.  You will love it!

PwBriZjb_u69RTujuaZPPA.review_text: Mario's was one of the few places I stumbled upon during my trip to San Francisco. I was hungry for lunch and was intrigued by the name, so decided to head inside.   First off, service was friendly but soooo slow. There were only two guys working and the place was pretty busy. I'm happy I didn't have anything strict on my schedule or else I would have had to get up and leave.  Food wise, I ordered half of a Mario's salad and half of the highly recommended meatball sandwich. The salad was fine, just your average house salad, but the meatball sandwich was great! The meatballs and sauce were so delicious, and it was covered in melty provolone cheese. Yum.  If I ever return perhaps I'll order to-go and avoid the long wait?

G5TfE1HRwR4PGTldlY7pag.review_text: I really like this place.  There are no cigars, just hip party kids who can give a shit about you. That's what makes it charming though. Oh and the raggae constantly playing puts me in a good mood.  The food is also great and it's a nice place to have a pint on a Saturday afternoon.  Just steer clear of the coffee.

CQ8OSQFPCCoo0ujxEyEVRA.review_text: Was visiting North Beach today while it was just sunny and gorgeous outside (yes, I am talking about San Francisco) and happened to stop by the window and read their menu. Don't expect something fancy here, just some simple, flavorful creations.  I had the grilled eggplant panini with mozzarella instead of feta cheese and I loved it. Simple flavors, nice and warm... it was just what I wanted.   I really welcomed the laid back nature of this place. You don't experience the over-zealous Italians greeting you at the sidewalk to reel you in which was so great. Just some friendly guys, making sandwiches and pouring beers. This place is a great escape from the hustle of touristy North Beach, right on the edge of Washington Square.

w632RkPs5VyIB9LYSaKXFA.review_text: So many good memories here. Been coming for 20 years. It' that kind of place.  North Beach might change, but Mario's does not.  The food is limited, but who cares because the sandwiches are the best you're going to get, the venue is so inviting it makes you want to sit there all day reading a paper and watching the people wander through the park.

3YqEmeoCXo_05rq2iPNs5Q.review_text: Classic North Beach! Mario's has been here for decades. The service is polite and friendly. The food is basic and oh so delicious! No fancy frills needed. Great view out into Washing Square Park; sit inside or outside. The name is slightly deceiving as they don't sell cigars anymore, but this place is pure history. Love it!

0lDl1Jg1Qz2KhvkfJKk6fw.review_text: Chicken foccacia sandwiches. There are two on the menu and they're both delicious. Get one of those and an Anchor Steam beer. Pick up a Chronicle from the corner (the crossword puzzle will be done but that's ok). Grab a table by the window overlooking Washington Square park. Get another Anchor Steam. You, my friend, are having the best lunch in the City.

P2r4Y0Sh8RugQJsMw_tFqg.review_text: This review is based on after dinner drinks and dessert. We arrive into the tiny place and there are two free tables, so we grab one and take a seat. Time passes and the server comes over and we order a drink each and 3 desserts. A lot more time passes. Drinks weren't complicated, 2 draft beers and 2 glasses of wine.   We're started to get antsy, bummed that are incredible dinner out can end like this, but finally the server comes over with....the dessert. Where do you serve food before drinks? When asked if we could get the drinks, the server replied "as you can see, we are really busy tonight." There are 5 tables, so if that's busy....well, we have problems.   At any rate we wait...and...wait for the drinks. Why start eating dessert when you have no liquid to wash it down? Drinks were the highlight because two of the three desserts were unedible. The chocolate cake was dry and tasted like a cake from Cosco. My ricotta cheesecake was reminiscent of a quiche, eggy tasting and like the chocolate cake, dry. I took one bite and pushed it the side. Tiramisu that my friend ordered was decent.  Server came by about 15 minutes later and I told him I didn't enjoy the cake. He said, "it's supposed to taste that way, it has ricotta." OK, but the point is I don't like it. Bill comes with cheesecake charged on it. I don't understand this, I didn't like it, I didn't eat it, but you are still going to charge me?  Bad service, bad desserts so I won't be going back.

NP-675YVy9URhNmdQdnWsQ.review_text: This is a nice enough little place, but I just have to weigh in negatively on the meatball sandwich. The ingredients are ok (the foccacia is nice of course), but it's cooked in that little oven and mine got singed and smokey, which was not good. I liked that they had a half-sandwich offering ($5.50 rather than $9.75), but they didn't mention the half is open-faced - not bad, just something I'd like to have known. The beer selection was fairly limited. I would recommend going one block over and getting an excellent meatball sandwich (or spectacular pizza) at Tony's Slice House.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: After trying to get in a few other places without success, we settled here.  The side door was locked so they can accommodate another table of 2 inside., where we were sat.  We shared the pizza special - prosciutto with arugula - $10?  The pizza fits on a dinner plate.  It was a nice thin crust pizza with a very generous portion of chopped up arugula on top.  The end crust was crispy.    Hubby had a pint of Sierra $5 and I had the Italian watermelon soda $2.    Service is a bit slow so be prepared to chill and enjoy the quaint ambiance - not the ideal place if you are in a hurry or with someone you can't carry a conversation with...

T7T1wli0Gy3s5rLmb87vKw.review_text: I saw this place reviewed on Check Please Bay Area, and thought it was worth checking out. Perhaps if you're a regular you'll get decent service. Our waiter made us wait way too long at every step along the way. I had a Panini that was ok and the atmosphere/location are good. I'd go back if the service wasn't so bad.

AFVGx2ke2XNdzjt9sX2kYA.review_text: The view is awesome!  I always have the panni and a house wine!  This place is so laid back perfect for unwinding.  I love to wander in the owner is always nice.  I love to bring my friends from out of town here.  It makes such a nice impression.

1UKab-nmvbBoyp6y6f052A.review_text: This corner cafe has a cozy ambience if you care to get over the barmaid's surly 'tude.

khvn7hhX08g33N5niO676w.review_text: Did not have a meal here, but I did have a delicious espressso made with love and care by an expert barista.   I believe the man had a moustache with the ends turned up.  What a sweetheart. We sat at our table for a long time and were never hassled to get up to make way for the diners.  The music was fantastic.  I intend to go back for a meal.

uoo9B8-2GnvTA5OunT60GQ.review_text: The name sounds almost like a liquor/cigarette shop with a deli..but it's quite a cute, cozy bar cafe across the street from Washington Square.    Friend and I ended up here to people watch over glasses of wine from one of the outdoor tables.  I wish they had names of the wines they serve on their menu though.  I had their pinot noir and it was delightful.    Nice weather, enjoyable company, an attentive waitress, yummy wine, and outdoor seating equals perfect SF afternoon/evening.

YaS3LMly8LeveGRYazRgPQ.review_text: I LOVE LOVE this place. The focaccia sandwiches are absolutely delicious! I haven't even tried anything else. Both chicken sandwiches and eggplant are great. Staff is super friendly and chill. My boyfriend and I had a great lunch at the bar one day and our waiter asked us to find Shark Week on the TV, giving our drinks for free :) Check it out! And check out the old pictures of Mario on the wall - very historic!

V6WZXcF8LHJWXmhZC5uc8Q.review_text: Sunny: I had their salami panini on a baguette. Absolutely fantastic: hot, crispy and flavorful. Simple ingredients, but the combination, with the panini press and voila! I would love to visit this place again. The atmosphere and friendly staff are great.   Nolan: Mario's is one of my favorite hang outs in north beach, it is a great place to be a regular at.  Their panini's are and focaccia sandwiches are delicious, great to enjoy on a nice day in the park or on a colder day in the restaurant with a pint.  My favorites are the salami panini, and grilled chicken #1 and #2 focaccia sandwiches.  They do a great home made tiramisu too!

QbR55hB1NyJiRanjWVsPrw.review_text: yummy yummy yummy. i love Mario's. it is everything good about San Francisco rolled into one place...mellow people, great food, wonderful neighborhood. this is why i love my hometown...  try the meatball sandwich:)

-0jQI-Ru2BAJsGsGcFglPw.review_text: Cute little spot. My friends brought me here to show me one of their old hangouts  from "back in the day". Mario's struck me as the stereotypical North Beach cafe in a positive way. You can come here and grab an espresso or a beer and kick back while enjoying a relaxing environment. It struck me as a good meeting place for friends. It has a pleasant environment with a  few frills and no fuss.  They're located right across from Washington Park so there's a lot going on if you're a people watcher like me. I wouldn't say you should go out of your way to visit this place but it's a great spot to stop in when you're in the area.

T4E1PMvIF78PKVMXnYcuRw.review_text: Great little cafe in north beach.  I'm a little sentimental because this was the first place I went to when I moved here.  It is in such a cool little corner location.  It makes you feel like you're in a little cafe in Europe.  Such a cool vibe.

yqBa9rXfqWjdNKUtmz7DRw.review_text: This place is the bomb-it does just what you want it to and doesn't tread into areas outside of their mastery. GREAT focaccia sandwiches, cheap vino, stupendous people-watching location, and wicked bad-breath inducing caeser. Eat your anchovies and kiss a stranger for a new twist!

NhCE_HoUkhNE8aDH6SURPA.review_text: This is probably one of my favorite places in the 'tourist' friendly North Beach.  Most places in North Beach don't need to keep up to par because they know they will have plenty of Union Square'ites visiting them.  The thinng that is cool about Marios is that is has a local feel and the food/drink are simple but good.  The menu is limited and they cook all their food out of an oven the size of a dishwasher.  The beer is always cold and fresh.  The wine is always cheap and tasty.  Great little place to take something to read and eat solo.

1dlT00tW1O84bdZPHeyTdg.review_text: I moved to San Diego after living two blocks from Marios and I crave it every day.  Hands down the best meatball sandwich EVER!!!  Go there and order it, you won't regret it.

bn0Bvmb5XwUYGnXi6O7M1A.review_text: The place sells not only tasty focaccia sandwich but ambiance.  We waited 20 minutes for Golden Boy to open and the grumbling in the belly moved us here.  It took them another 20 minutes, but the waitress was super courteous and so friendly that we smiled through the wait.  Seems like a true North Beach place, as she knows most people by name as they come in.    It's a small place, with limited menu items, but we'd return for the sandwich served by great staff at the table outside facing the square.  Even if the service is a bit slow, it just gives you time to slow down to the pace of the neighborhood.

UKyn4Q-lyK5knej-OXkskw.review_text: I used to live around the corner from Mario's and it was one of my favorite North Beach spots.  The polenta & sausage dish was my fave but I don't think I ever ate anything I didn't like there.  The hipster waiters are a little stand-offish but they warm up once they get to know you.  The dreadlocked dude (does he still work there?) didn't really acknowledge my existence until I had been a regular for about a year.  But I figured he was the guy picking all the great reggae music so I lived with it.  They also have some seats outdoors across from the park which are a great spot for and afternoon lunch.

7XdxTuCY8a9OezIxc5Lmzg.review_text: User to live in SF for more than 7 Years. Walters were nice and polite. Location is great, food is mediocre at best. G-man

W2DuKlBALsA8O3XjENnn_A.review_text: Get the eggplant sandwich, the breaded one. My friends & I have been going here for, holy crap, almost 20 yrs just for that. Grab a table looking out on Washington Square.   Then maybe walk up Columbus for some truffles from XOX. A good place to meet friends for lunch on a rainy day. Or a sunny day. Or a non-sunny night.

RNqUxVGKYMHZZmBEcH4iVg.review_text: The place is cool to hang out, have good coffee, or a beer.  I ordered a chicken panini sandwich that was insipid, I asked for some olive oil and vinegar to dip my sandwich into because I couldn't taste much flavor but the bread was good.  The server was nice, I sat on the bar by the door which was kind of annoying since people kept walking in without closing the door and it was windy.  Really people, you walk into a place, close the door behind you, is called courtesy.  Try it.

G7eeiEtL7Y3u-T7Fij-Wgw.review_text: Pretty good sandwiches, a little touristy-feeling, and a little too pricey for the food you're buying. Not bad... just not somewhere I plan to visit often when there are so many better options in N.Beach.

HaqL5KNW5bqCwTX7Y8pigQ.review_text: Chicken sandwich #2 is my go-to order when eating in or taking out. I live in the neighborhood and love this spot.

XQ-m75M0aCkCckFBjL0d4w.review_text: You will never go wrong with a meatball sandwich--or with the breaded eggplant sandwich--accompanied by a glass of chianti at Marios.  Its the atmosphere that puts it over the top, right on the corner off Washington Square, watching all the local color and enjoying a bit of old time North Beach ambiance.

IqKj8kMJEe8nyOeIuGRpoA.review_text: oh my god!  the combo changed my life.  and i only had 4 bites.  the sandwich was rich, cheesey, hot and yummy.  mmmmmm!  can't stop thinking about it.  can't wait to eat a whole one....or two.

c14mdc_XMbDF-70UJIh7uA.review_text: Went back to Mario's and am happy to report that it's still awesome. I have yet to find better foccacia bread in the city and forgot to mention my delight over the peppercinis that come with each sandwich. Delicious. I also enjoy the camaraderie between the staff members. Love this place!

wCtf5_zG8EpWiBp_Oi7P0g.review_text: I want more places like this  in Boston. It is a tiny little cafe/bar/sandwich shop and supposedly a cigar store too? All of  that packed into one tiny corner shop??   You walk in here and see the big oven to cook their pizzas and paninis and to melt all of the cheese that Kelly D. got on her tuna melt. That oven is tucked into  the bar itself  and when we were there, they had two awesome people working, the guy who worked the bar and made all of our food made sure we were all completely happy with our sandwiches and pizza. Frances S. and I both got panini's, mine with chicken and pesto and sundried tomatoes and cheese all melted and toasted together and Frances S. got their mozzarella panini and we were both pretty happy with them. A little on the small side though for the cost and definitely in comparison to Kelly D's tuna melt which was made open face style, and I pretty much had  sandwich envy with that  one ha ha Kat got one of their sausage pizzas and she also seemed pretty darn content.   A nice quaint little bar and lunch spot that if you happen to be walking around this area, I know the people here will treat you like they are your friends.

_rCTsmoYmWmM-F33PBGN2w.review_text: Fun place to stop by for a beer or coffee.    Sandwiches are good too.  Kinda small, but that's part of the charm.

q9NM8_ExzpkoxskbKRvcDg.review_text: I am not into cigars or bars, but someone introduced me to Mario's long, long ago, and I have been a fan ever since. Consider this great comfort food. I am a fan of the hot foccacia sandwiches. I've had veggie and breaded eggplant. I get one or the other and have been for the last twelve years. Sometimes I think of trying something else, but I am worried the eggplant will miss me. On my last visit, I sat at the counter for the first time (usually I'm at the small table in back) and enjoyed watching the food being made. Kudos to the sandwich makers!

b5xky1NsvoaUK4ScJT695g.review_text: Nothing too fancy at this place.  Just delicious grilled panini accompanied by great beers on tap and an authentic old school vibe.  What more could you ask for?

zZVlTm9PQKd6js3QbURlWg.review_text: Great atmosphere for an impressive (and AFFORDABLE) dinner with friends. Came based on Yelp reviews. I would come back in a heartbeat.   FOOD/BEER: Mouth-watering. Ordered a pitcher of their summer special beer, a stout that tasted amazing. They're famous for their foccacia, so I ordered an eggplant foccacia that came out steaming hot and smelling seductive.  Went to Gelateria Naia next door for delicious dessert to top off the evening!  SERVICE: Meh, nothing to complain about. Waitress mostly stayed out of our way but checked in on us; I was hoping for a homey, mom-and-pop manager with whom my friend could practice his Italian, but the waitress didn't seem friendly or Italian.

RWIuUNWFYYWS2tbQ6VzKJg.review_text: This place is very nice. I love North Beach and all its cafes. After passing by this cafe many times, I never went in even though it looked alluring, but after hearing that they have the "best foccacia sandwiches" on Bay Area Backroads I decided to give it a go. I ordered the turkey foccacia with pepper jack cheese and onions, and I replaced the dijon mustard with red bell peppers. We sat outside and it was very comfortable, and the sandwiches came right away. Sadly, they don't carry "exotic" Torani flavors like coconut or mango, so I had to settle for a peach Italian soda. It was still yummy. The sandwich was very very tasty, nice crispy bread and great cheese.. kinda spicy too, which I liked. I had a bite of both the grilled eggplant and breaded eggplant sandwiches and they were awesome. A+

JhHo2-fej5do28snWXSSnQ.review_text: Cheaper and more reliable than the string of overpriced tourist-centered Italian cafes down the block. This place is cozy without the overly-friendly waiters that I find to be overbearing in most of North Beach.   Good lunch spot for panini, focaccia sandwiches (breaded eggplant!), cannelloni and lasagna. Go at off-times (like 2pm for lunch) since table seating is sparse and this place tends to fill up.

Ngk3BorlpPc0QV_xuo3xvw.review_text: Killer cappuccinos, excellent panini on focaccia bread, consistently groovy SF vibe with interesting tunes from the 60's. Highly recommended, unless you are a tourist.  For the location and ambience, they get an extra star.

UfRm6t31UuCJ8u50Sc24VQ.review_text: Omg yum! We stopped in for sandwiches late in the afternoon and were not let down. We got the grilled eggplant and the chicken number 1 and were very pleased with our meals. Personally, I had the eggplant and it was so delicious!  The foccacia was very flavor and crispy and the filling was just right. Highly recommend!

sA4ZTzEFNZSh668S2sldaQ.review_text: A historic boho bar and sandwich joint perfectly located across from Washington Park and St. Peter and Paul's church. A great place for an afternoon break in North Beach.

bD2VZd1WlLGEp9B_r8aitQ.review_text: Great little cafe with excellent food and good service! My girlfriend and I visited San Francisco and went to this place almost every day! Every time we tried somewhere else, it wasn't as good and we thought, "Why didnt we just go to Mario's?"

XwsvbmuPyW7hl39yux8giQ.review_text: Great place for a quick bite - really good friendly service, good and simple food, and absolutely terrific hot focaccia sandwiches.  A great place to head if you just want a simple place to grab lunch or dinner

tUKpixy4c24_2W0PngxooA.review_text: The lasagna was greasy, the glasses were dirty, and the wine list consisted of "cab" or "merlot"  I think we ordered the meatball sandwich too, but it was so uneventful I don't really remember if it was "ok" or ''good", but it certainly wasn't great or memorable.  I wanted to like it, the location is great, but the actual quality of food and beverage was low.  I suppose if you want to grab a beer and sit at a bar in a prime location it's good. I was terribly unimpressed :(

aIma8XWJUh_CIW3XbOBWvw.review_text: On a whim, or rather, on a bit of Yelp research, I discovered Mario's.   Yelp again succeeds- the eggplant foccacia sandwich not only made me solidify my position on eggplant in the positive. I found myself searching the plate for any dropped crumbs of this sandwich that I could find after devouring it.   It's a bit pricey for sandwiches, but not too pricey for awesome sandwiches.

cTvnc3yOhFQzOQEtSE-xLg.review_text: I'm about to leave North Beach after a year here, so it's time to write a review of my favorite corner cafe.  Mario's has provided that perfect North Beach feeling for me: sitting on a street corner with my son, having excellent food, and watching people go by.  I always get the same: a caprese, a balsamic chicken oven-baked foccacia sandwich (chicken #2), and a glass of vermentino (or a cappuccino if I need the caffeine).  The caprese is good, though I'd prefer better tomatoes.  But the oven-baked balsamic chicken is amazing: moist and tender, smoky flavor, light touch on the balsamic, with good greens, tomato, and feta.  Funky vermentino by the glass is nice as well.  I'll miss this place.

7Na1pUcEv3oF_QTRwZ-2iw.review_text: Love this place!  -delicious foccaccia  - great drink selection -prices are low  -cool vibe -always leave full  BEST PANINIS in SF!

5Xp1puM4TMVPvwox_ryu6A.review_text: I was really disappointed when I went there in late May. I used to go there back in the 80s and early 90s and the food was so much better. The focaccia is completely different from the recipe they used back then, when it was fresh, chewy, and delicious - this time is was a little overly crisp and the flavor was just not very good. My sausage sandwich was cold and not much better after I asked the guy to put it in the oven again (annoyance factor). My partner's meatball sandwich was...meh. The hipster dudes behind the bar seemed not that excited with their job. I won't be going back to spend my hard earned smacks when there's so much other good food in this city!

-aX9XhJQYvnDvzwW6YRYlw.review_text: Unpretentious perfection. Amazing staff! Excellent food! Perfect location!  I suggest- Breaded Eggplant sandwich, and an IPA draft. Chill, and tip your servers well!  Cheers!

pdilmEaeXuntV4eTnc9KcQ.review_text: No smoking of cigars, but the oven baking the focaccia sandwiches can fill up the place with that burnt bread smell that's actually kind of nice, but makes your clothes stink for days.  I've enjoyed every visit to Mario's.  It's the kind of place that I would love to own.  Or what I'd use as a template for the perfect comfortable cafe with food and wine.  I order a half carafe of the montepulciano, an Italian red and the eggplant marinara sandwich on focaccia.  They layer the sandwich with thin slices of breadcrumb coated fried eggplant, roasted red peppers and then a layer of provolone.  Then bake it open-faced in the oven on the wall.  After ten or fifteen minutes, they slap the two sides together and slice it diagonally and garnish with those green pepperocinis, which I bite the end off, pour the tangy vinegar into the sandwich and then munch down as I eat the sandwich and sip the red wine in smallish hexagonal tumbler glasses.   One memorable time was when my brother Rufus visited and we went there on a Monday for dinner.  It was raining out.  We ate and had the wine.  It continued to rain, they had cool music playing.  Coltrane or Sonny Rollins or Thelonious Monk...  Anyway, we didn't leave that place for 3 hours just laughing about dumb things we used to do as kids and can now talk about.  No reason to go out in the rain when you've already found a cool place to hang. I do have to admit that in the past few years, the charm has changed a bit for the worse.  The lighting is now much brighter and too bright in my opinion. I like it dim when work on getting a good wine buzz.  And the jazz music has been replaced by either dancey world music or reggae or just contemporary Alice-type music.  Maybe it's the workers who just play their iPods or whatever they want.   The great foccacia they use for the sandwich is from Liguria Bakery on the corner of Stockton and Filbert, but the Italian French Bakery up the street on Grant @ Union makes a decent substitute, but it's not the soft wonderful foccacia from Liguria.  There's a difference.  They ran out of the Liguria foccacia bread for the sandwiches a couple of times too and I asked about when they changed to the Italian French Bakery foccacia, our waitress was convinced it's always been the same.  They also installed a few taps of draft beer, which is nice, but I suggest the red wine with the sandwiches.  2006, the old school is changing.  Update: They had a sign on the window saying they're using Liguria focaccia.  Hmm.  Maybe they read the yelp reviews...cool.

tMvLorYiqTteITTEvys6HA.review_text: My most favorite place to eat in North Beach!!!  The best panini's i've ever had! They also make wonderful lattes. Just a simple little restaurant that serves great food and provides a relaxing environment.  You can't go wrong at Mario's.

496e9_P-xJnHbR3gEADaVQ.review_text: I have a weakness for focaccia sandwiches and funky cafe names, and Mario's does not disappoint.  Order the grilled chicken #1 (especially if you like dijon mustard), grab the Onion paper off the counter, and enjoy one of those rare sunny San Francisco days.

e3NowcEKREbtH2qa_ZUPMQ.review_text: One can't go wrong here. Yes, it is pricey, but look where it is. A classic place to watch the day go by.

sU5a5IvwZCOMt7xx1ceuQg.review_text: One of my fav places to eat in the city!  One night while on a cab ride to North Beach we asked our cabbie which place he liked the best and he said that the meatball sammies here are hard to beat.  Yeah, I've been twice now and he he was right!!  They are so yummy and filling.  I also had the caprese salad too which was a great, light accompaniment to the sandwich.  It's authentic, cheap, and a great lunch!  I would rather eat here then pay way more for some fancy Italian place up Columbus.  It's way better.  This cafe is so old and authentic.  Tip: take a trip to the bathroom in the back.  It's tiny!!  When it is a sunny day, there's really no where else I'd rather be.  Out the window you can see gorgeous Washington Sq and once outside Coit tower is in view!  Awww, I so miss living in SF.  *sigh*

a4kLuLwhU9uxPLW7igBv7A.review_text: Nice corner bar. The manager/bartender was arrogant and ignored me for awhile. Didn't want me taking pictures. It would be great if the service was just a little friendlier.

4AwA8QlK6NR4kMfyCvlrJw.review_text: Walked around North Beach yesterday morning for a half hour looking for a place that 1. was open for lunch, and 2. would fulfill my random intense craving for an eggplant parm panini and a diet soda.  Stumbled into Mario's and was happily surprised that it met these requirements.  One enjoyable conversation with the server and one absolutely delicious panini (for real... the focaccia bread was AMAZING) later, and I was happily off to enjoy the rest of my day!

Syt_iQqW_c9T2_lrvsddqQ.review_text: I'm just stealing this from another review; it's not worth any additional effort:  "Anyhow, our experience was so unpleasant I doubt we will ever step foot back into this place...  And to the bartender with the slicked-back dark hair and goatee---you are a jerk and I suggest you brush up on your customer service skills."  That is all.

8IeUGe4ffhx-KJVc4xkqjQ.review_text: Oh my!  I was temporarily transported to Florence last night when I scooped a spoonful of their housemade tiramisu into my mouth!  Heaven pure Italian heaven on a plate.    I've been going to Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store Cafe since the late 1970s and have so many fantastic memories of this place.  Every time I go I acquire a new and immensely pleasant experience.  Last night was no exception.  We had a cappuccino con "Vov", their special house made "campari", and the tiramisu and our night was blissfully perfect.  The cappuccino con "Vov" is a frothy cup of vanilla/eggnoggy goodness.  I'm hooked on their house made "campari" which is a blend of sweet and dry vermouth, bitters, a splash of soda and a perfect twist of lemon.  Our server suggested the tiramisu and outside of Alberto's in Florence this was hands down the best.  A gushy, creamy, wet mass of cake, cream, and liquor just as it should be.  Thank you Mario's for yet another memorable experience!

0OgM7Ma1AJmP_t86HsPMFg.review_text: IT IS WORTH THE CALORIES! My favorite thing about work--Is the lunch hour.  No seriously, I brake for lunch only because the food is so good in North Beach, not because I need the pounds.  Can I tell you--Mario's is my office away from the office. We go there daily for meetings and you will not find better canneloni, well, pannini's well, lasagna and bread and hefty pours of wine.  All in all, it is the neighborhood hang out and we Love It.  The people that work there are not servers they are friends.  This place rocks.  Not Low Cal but Worth It!

b0p3fOxJcZjB3iTl7zoqTA.review_text: Go there and try the canneloni.  It takes a few minutes, but when they pull it out of the oven, you'll be the envy of the place.

CSl3chHc4aLsoEHNCsEgSA.review_text: Stellar cafe, and a true San Francisco landmark.  Most of the Italian joints in North Beach are cheesy, but this one has the history and food to match the great location (right on Washington Square).  Pull up a chair at the counter, order your machiatto (they make them well) and get a grilled sandwich.  Best sandwiches in North Beach, only caveat is don't sit outside cuz sometimes the staff will forget about you.

Vp14grGEIvYzmrsOdix4UQ.review_text: Best. Lasagna. EVER.   Bohemian, yes... Cigars, not so much. Which is great news, because instead they have delicious food!  I personally ordered the grilled eggplant panini, which was incredible, but the lasagna was actually the best of its kind that I've tried yet. The carafe of red wine and the sunny day certainly helped, although it did get a touch cold on the terrace because the sun wasn't directly hitting it. Despite the homeless serenader and the nippiness, however, it was a fabulous way to spend a lovely President's Day and be outside after such a long week of rain. Our server slash bartender was friendly, in a quirky hipster kind of way, and the prices were the usual North Beach standard... which, in this case, were absolutely worth it. Very quaint, right next to Washington Square Park, and great for people-watching without being right slap in the middle of the chaos. Even the bizarre restroom set-up seemed strangely enchanting after such a scrumptious meal and charming experience!

SIcz9tmyUGlZtiaa39fBsQ.review_text: When I lived in the neighborhood, this was my never fail go-to spot.  A small corner space with windows looking out onto Washington Square Park, a comfortable place to sit and drink wine and talk for hours.  I'm partial to the cannelloni that comes bubbling from the small counter oven.

7yoZgNgUBNRU1wCVHpK2Gw.review_text: Mario's has delicious focaccia sanwiches and the best espresso in north beach (Graffeo beans) made from some really wonderful antique machine.  it's a bummer Mario's can't serve cigars/allow smoking.

yH4E7zen5rI-rRM2UeAFKA.review_text: The lasagna is my favorite.I always get it. Best lasagna in town....sorry grandma

KE8OqqLW2aJpzPNJy55x4A.review_text: Great sandwich shop.  Nothing like the hot foccacia eggplant sandwich.  And to user "Catwoman" from Santa cruz - I asked you why you gave a one star review to a restaurant where you didn't even dine or order a cup of coffee.  You responded, "And why do you care what my opinion of the place is?  You live on the other side of the country and have never even been to the place I was reviewing...."   You asked me a question, and then you block me.  How do you know if I've been there or not?  You think people don't travel or live different places or move around?  I just asked you a question about your one star review where you weren't even a customer there....

3b4efqz06QrLQ_w2xLc4pA.review_text: My friend and I got the sausage sandwich and the #2 chicken sandwich: both were very good. The staff was friendly. It's a great place to sit, enjoy and watch the world go by, which is a plus.

r0N7ck7_quS_kvh9JEmfWw.review_text: I'm not going to say the menu wowed me but the people, decor and the location did. Just came out of lunchtime prayers at St. Francis with thoughts of death, retribution and light weapons tactics weighing heavily in my well calculated thoughts, and I needed a place to chill before getting back to work. The beer list is nice and it is a vibe from the old town that I miss. So completely worth it. The food probably is good too. I had a salad, so hard to judge. I'm gonna try the tuna melt next time.

9YzE6ybg4Trnsd4kkXWEnQ.review_text: Love this place!  I think the best words to describe this place are: cute, quaint, friendly, & delicious.    Mario's is on the corner of Union and Columbus right across from Washington Square.  The windows look out to the park and busy street.  It's a great spot for people watching, sipping coffee, reading a book, and catching up with a friend.  There are about 10 seats at the bar, and about 5 small tables that can fit 2 people (can fit up to 4 if you squeeze).  No big groups here!    Very nice/helpful staff - if you have questions about the menu, feel free to ask.  You will get no rude talking back here!  As for food, there's a Great assortment of sandwiches, paninis, and salads (my friend highly recommends the meatball sandwich!)  Plus, coffees, lattes, mochas, etc.  Everything is delicious and very fresh!  I was surprised to find such a light meal here because Italian food is generally heavier, but after leaving here, I felt energized and healthy.  I will definitely be coming back!  :D

becChstN1Nelt61S8j8exQ.review_text: Perfect SF hang out.  Best turkey sandwich I've ever had.

3tkyUW4xtIsLPD7n1ZdXUw.review_text: I used to always get my lunch here. I miss your sandwiches. That's all I've ever ordered here, and I miss them dearly. Perfect in a lot of ways, minus one. It's no longer close to home.  Miss the great service, and humble atmosphere.

TuP8ovZUL3kXtJnE2B71bA.review_text: Their meatball sandwiches are the star of the show.  Nice and gooey with a non-traditional foccacia bread that was perfectly seasoned and complemented the meatballs very well.

mOCM896HwdM4sL961RRNHg.review_text: I ordered a combo sandwich and an anchor steam. The guy taking my order immediately said "some guys have been coming in here and ordering that or 20 years". Good to know, I was a little concerned that I would not make it out of here alive after eating it. I am not saying this because it was bad, because it was not, it was delicious. I mean really delicious!! ...but it was all meat, cheese, and mayo on a very oily (but also delicious) focaccia roll.   The people here were a mix of regulars and tourists. I had a good time listening to some visitors and the staff talking about the appropriate maximum amount of time to keep ground coffee beans.  They have Peroni to go along with your italian meal but if you are not into that sort of thing your only real other option is anchor steam. The rest of the beers are mostly the boring blue moon type stuff.   Finally, Thanks for the great service. I sat at the bar and was always being taken care of. The staff obviously is intent on keeping this place the classic that it is.  I am going to try the Cannelloni next time...

kVcBS5R1lSIjFrVD8MPTEw.review_text: This place has some of the best paninis and focaccia sandwiches!  I love to sit at the bar and look at the old pictures or outside on the sidewalk overlooking Washington Square Park and have a beer while I wait for my sandwich.  Everytime a friend of mine comes to visit, she requests we come here.  If you are in a rush or one of those people that can't chill and enjoy a good atmosphere while you wait for your food, do not come here if there are a lot of people.  It is a small, casual, corner joint and they have room for just one oven and one person to make the food - but that is personally what I love about it!

RPD2MK_RJbCY_GFsLAZjig.review_text: Love Mario's...i have been going here for years now. Usually to meet a friend who lives in north beach. I definitely agree with everyone the meatball sandwich is divine. So grab a samich and a glass of wine or beer and socialize with the crowd. It is a small place but feels more cozy than crowded.

0GMMy-FD8ImVsF4M6CAE5Q.review_text: Great Focaccia in a small corner cafe of Litty Italy.

x-i8n-WW7YHrhRrPHos75A.review_text: BEST CAPPUCCINO IN SF!!! Im serious. And the food is great too. I beeline here whenever Im in the 'hood.

YUQuJA0i5Y4wobydFjhYiA.review_text: I only had 30 minutes until my open house started so I should've ordered a salad but the hot sandwiches everyone else was eating looked way too good so I ordered a turkey sandwich with melted cheese and dijon mustard and a beer. The beer took 5 to 7 minutes and the sandwich 12 to 15 minutes even though it was not that busy. Is this too long? Not if your hanging out with friends, but it seems like forever when your eyeing the clock. The beer (Anchor Steam) was good as always, the sandwich was out of this world! Too bad I didn't get a napkin (I was served by the cook who was a little flighty, he should stick to the cooking).  If your in North Beach and want a hot sandwich and a beer and don't mind paying $20 a person with tip you owe your self a trip to this great cafe!

Bx1iLCgUyu4HPepkYut4Uw.review_text: Mario's is a great neighborhood cafe. I love stopping by this place for a cappuccino/beer/panini/whatever. I'm not a huge panini fan, but I come here for their paninis. Service is friendly, even though it's a small place you won't feel rushed out if you want to sit there and read for a bit. I like how even though it's in a touristy area, it does't feel touristy. No complaints at all.

lcBxErp_W1aNAPD_2RikcA.review_text: Mario's was great.   After ordering, it took at least a half hour to get our food, but the price, taste, and location more than make up for that.   I love the fact that you can get a half salad or half sando for half the price. I really enjoyed the Caesar salad and meatball sandwich!  Will definitely be back. They do takeout too, which is a great alternative most of the priceyer, sit down restaurants in north beach if you want something quick, easy, yummy and cheap.

MsbIFptSdbUIBng23wFhbw.review_text: always a great espresso served right and the tiramisu always perfect.  The lemon ricotta cheesecake was not on the menu due to Mario's widow broke her arm a couple weeks ago.  This is the kind of place it is.  I have been going there for years.  Always a treat and the current staff was really nice.

pBAnCaacZRtk1PWtjPANAA.review_text: Gavin Newsom. Here. Ordering a chicken focaccia sandwich. It was surreal.  Can you imagine his life? Wake up, cocaine, throw on fancy pants and casually sophisticated white oxford, cocaine, make a speech at whatever city event, cocaine, have lunch at Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store Cafe, cocaine, glad hand old ladies at whatever city fundraiser, cocaine, service his married cougar mistress, cocaine, act all mayorally (sic), cocaine, fall asleep in the limo. Yelp friends, it all sounds pretty GOOD to me...minus the cocaine.  Honestly, he seems like an OK guy. I would have liked to say to a few choice words to him, but I was too busy devouring my meatball sandwich. I'm fat, Gavin ain't.  Gavin Newsom, 3 stars. Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store Cafe, 5 stars.

XQMaAvF3YUslCD-0tZY1xg.review_text: Came in on Friday April 13th for dinner - and was impressed. We ordered a Caesar Salad -- split onto two plates and made to perfection, simple yet tasty along with the Canneloni and the Veggie Sandwich.  Each item was prepared in front of us - by the staff and tasted amazing and a great value for the price. I will definitely be back again.

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: We were walking around North Beach this past weekend and Mario's had been on our list to try out and we finally got the chance to.  We both ordered the meatball sandwich which had been written up all over the place.  When we sat down there was a framed letter from Mario Batali mentioning how much he loved the meatball sandwich so we knew we had to order it.  It was delicious too.  The onion focaccia it was on was amazing and had a great flavor.  I ordered an Italian soda too which was tasty.  We got there a bit before noon and it wasn't to busy but by the time we left it was packed so maybe get there a little early and enjoy.

iyMdItITmFx7-LmRV2-F0Q.review_text: Quaint, friendly, and unpretentious atmosphere with fresh, olive-oily focaccia. Neither the sandwiches nor the people-watching will disappoint. It's almost a small piece of Europe within San Francisco -- fortunately without the smoking.

4U6g5TcuTD1QvQf_uZPz6Q.review_text: Have been coming here every time that I visit SF since 1991. We last weekend (Jan. 10) - order the same meatball sandwich every time and love it every time.   A few years, ago, my wife and I went, sat at the bar and someone put on a full James Brown record. Marios - meatball sandwich, great coffee and James Brown! We always talk about that experience.  Staff is very nice; food the best (at a reasonable rate) - a trip to SF is never complete until we go to Marios!

odM7WqRsORcMsFymWEMiAw.review_text: Damn good.  And lots of personality, too.  Probably the best Eggplant Parmagiana Foccacia sandwich I've had.  Lovely room.  Great staff.

jveIBHpWOfZFv24luiDjPA.review_text: Lots of history and the building is really old and cool but the food sucked! There are like 5o restaurants in the area, my guess is that for food you can do better. If you want a cup of coffee or an expresso I'm sure its a great place.

_vjsG7AJhw_44xC6M3YDXw.review_text: Food was okay for the most part. Salads were sad but the meatball sandwhich was great.  Service was awful. Our waiter was incredibly rude, sarcastic and arrogant. That, along with the long wait for the food and the bill, made the whole experience a nightmare.  After we finished the meal and asked for the bill we waited over a half an hour and eventually had to ask the waitress to remind our waiter because no one in our group even wanted to talk to him at that point.   As good as that sandwhich was the service was so bad there is no way i would ever go back.

H7pOIDkDqUBjBj1ulCwk7g.review_text: The warm sausage sandwich on toasted green onion foccacia bread is to die for. It's so filling that I often order just a half sandwich. I guess I've been ordering it for 47 years and it's still wonderful and tastes the same as it did in 1967. On rare occasions I order the meatball sandwich which I guess is equally as good but even though I'm an experimental Gemini, I seem to end up with the sausage version.   Get it with a beer or Orangeno soft drink and you can't go wrong. Their deserts are limited but their cake has always been good and fresh although I usually go across Columbus to Mara's Bakery for canolli or a raspberry ring unless the ahole owner is there who seems to hate everyone unless you are a local Italian.    I have to thank a long out of print booklet titled "My Secret San Francisco" for turning me onto Marios Bohemian Cigar Store which I don't know if they ever sold cigars.

y5BWogG5nO9jH7Fi-ss7GQ.review_text: You know those random Sundays when you can't motivate yourself to work out or run errands?  When all you want to do is relax and be entertained on the cheap...anywhere other than your apartment?  Well, Mario's is my solution for those particular doldrums.  Come in with yourself and either a book or a friend.  Order a coffee or a glass of wine, and perch at the bar or grab a tiny table next to the window.  Sit as long as you like and watch the tourists, church-goers, and older Tai-Chi-loving folks in Washington Square Park.    Breathe, grab a little snack, and relish that you have a whole afternoon before you have to get back to grindstone on Monday.

UCTin7iQ_oR0E11EYemsEw.review_text: Love the food and atmosphere, but can't stand the arrogance of the bartenders / servers.  5+ for foccacia sandwiches  2 for staff

rAFBtociqzge2afydDy2nA.review_text: The best Meatball sandwich I've ever had. I love this place, I always stop in when I'm in Northbeach. Great Italian beers - great atmosphere, get there early because it gets crowded. Hit it on a weekday.

qF5BaqUhCHXGKGU-44Nwow.review_text: Just love the entire scene of this place. Its at the corner of Washington Square Park. They have outdoor seating, and a cozy indoor cafe/bar. The sandwiches are so good on their fresh Foccacia bread, definitely get the Meatball. They also have pitchers of beer to wash it all down. Just a really great find in my favorite neighborhood!

cMSZp7Go1bPKEQMYqStaXA.review_text: I instantly loved the neighborhood vibe I got from this place. A small joint, nothing fancy but not grimy either. My friend and I went family-style and ordered the mozzarella panini, eggplant parmesan,  a basket of focaccia bread, and pinot grigio. I have no complaints. The food was impeccable. Overall, if you are looking to have a quick bite (not fast food) in an unpretentious environment, check of this North Beach classic.

Av14iV8L9700Lsvdm21DtQ.review_text: It makes me so sad to write this because I used to adore this place. But after the last few visits here I've decided this place is kind of shit.  First off, there's no seating. Heaven forbid you arrive in a group with more than two people and have to cram yourselves in one of their tiny ass tables. To be honest, their tables aren't even that small. There's just no place to walk hence, no room to pack four chairs around a table that could easily sustain a small group of people. If there is a fire, you will fucking die.   I get it, it's San Francisco and space is expensive. If you come on your lonesome or on a date though the space isn't that much of an issue.  Come in with a small group of friends and you'll get some eye rolls from one of the waiters aka wanna-be-king of hipsters, Moustachio ( Epic stache and epic douche ) Anyways, you'll know who I'm talking about when you see him.   Food is pretty pricey considering how little you get. For $8 you can get a tiny ass sandwich with mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil. That's it. They won't even spring for a handful of potato chips because fuck you. They give you a couple pepperoncini's though.    I think the part that really irks me about this place is the service.   I get it people have bad days and sometimes their service is a bit off. I'm just going to get straight to the point here and say the waiters here are simply bitches. No, they aren't having a bad day because Urban Outfitters burned down and they don't know where else to buy Holga film.  They're just bitches.  Moustachio can't hear your requests for service over his unnecessary facial hair. He hates giving soda refills too because carbonated water and 5 cents worth of syrup is a total scam.   There's another chick that works there that acts like she is so inconvenienced because she has customers to service- ironic considering we are the reason she has a fucking job. She slammed a cup of coffee once on our table and then sauntered over to Moustachio to faun over how large and thick his moustache is. Giggling and twirling the ends of her upper lip facial hairs that someday hope to become as hipster-y as Moustachio.   She's a bitch. He's a bitch. Food is pretty good but pricey and as filling as a holy communion bread chip during a 2-hour Christmas Eve mass right before dinner.

OqgYxqEHc9K7oq-8VHJgxw.review_text: Excellent Panini sandwitches and a good Italian wine list.  The Italian sodas here are certainly the bomb, and the sandwitches, oh the sandwitches, all warm and gooey and toasted perfectly on their old school panino press...Try the turkey, which is always one of my favorites...This place is quite small and can get quite cramped with all of the tourists of north beach, but the wait and the tight quarters is worth it once you bite into one of those darling sandwitches...

kL-M7e4dBDe3nTr4qLvE_Q.review_text: So I've just come down from a walk over Telegraph Hill, and I'm thinking a little dinner would be just the thing, and there's Mario's, and so here I am writing a review while I finish my wine and reflect on why this is one of my favorite comfort food spots.  Most of my old favorite North Beach restaurants are gone, replaced by places that are hipper, shinier, airier, pricier, and packed with tourists and dudebros from the Marina.  Mario's is one of the remaining holdouts, a funky little triangular building with a bar on one side and a few tables on the other, with a great view of the park.  You can get a meal here for under ten bucks and a drink for under five.  It's mostly a local crowd, a good number of youngish hipster types like myself, but there are still a few older North Beach Italians who haven't been driven out yet.  The menu is small and focused -- salads, panini, pasta, that kinda thing.  All of it good.  I go for the cannelloni more often than not; it reminds me of Christmas Eve when I was a kid.  Decent wine and beer selection, and they make a nice cappuccino.  I don't know if it's the good food, the laid-back atmosphere, the drink, or what, but I can't think of a time I have come here and not had it elevate my mood.

ooRqTtP8NLP068cnkWpUYw.review_text: Get some focaccia and be happy. They also serve really good tiramisu :) Been a fan since 04. Would always go back when in north beach.

hFn4mjyLOXsgmR1wEtVa8Q.review_text: Toasted sandwiches made from Liguria foccacia are dreamy.  They're the dreamiest when you've been wandering hungrily within a 1-mile radius of North Beach and want a seat and a dinner that's in no way a big production.  Barstool, beer, bohemian eggplant & mozzarella.

xyNdK7m0i1Y4pb4gJicA6g.review_text: Note: no cigars or related found here. Sorry, cigar aficionados.   Ambiance: Small and cozy, about 4-5 tables for three, with a bar. Quaint dark wood interior, and a split door entrance with character. Everyone is guaranteed a view of lovely green Washington Square, which is directly across the street. Depending on who is manning the CD carousel, you'll be listening to soothing bossa nova, new age world music, or lively Spanish salsa. Loud but not too loud for table conversation.  Seems to be a quiet choice for active, 20s and 30s North Beach locals who happen to be in the vicinity. Not one tourist to be seen.  Only one bathroom. It's in the back, as large as an airplane restroom, without the mirror. Seems almost like it was installed as an afterthought.  Drink:  Kinda on the small portion size for the money, but hey, it's North Beach. Tea options are nothing exotic and quite limited (about 5 choices of bagged supermarket-grade tea), while coffees are standard fare. They do better by their coffee. Of course, they also have beers, many in bottles and about 3 on tap - I'm personally happy to find Italian beers here, even if only in bottles.  Food:  The desserts are a bit disappointing. Their tiramisu and ricotta cheesecake are the only ones homemade there. The cheesecake tasted nothing of cheese, strongly resembling angel food cake in taste, look and texture. The lower half of the cheesecake was some sort of egg custard. Better to go with a meal order, as that is where their strength lies.  Service:  Good and friendly. The staff is youthful, calm, all smiles and happy to give recommendations and answers.

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: After having the meatball focaccia sandwich bookmarked for ages I think that I waited to long to finally try it. Not because I've been missing out but because so many good sandwich shops are now in business. So whereas the meatballs were tender and the sandwich was okay, it just wasn't great.   I guess if I lived nearby I would stop by more often not because of the food but because of the vibe. It's apparent that this place attracts regulars who banter with each other and the staff during the day. Very cozy and convivial atmosphere.

X_9DrBW2oI_FR21nf7yx8w.review_text: The lasagna here is the ultimate winter comfort food. Mario's is very cozy, with an old-fashioned San Francisco atmosphere. It's a good place for dates ... my parents had their first date here in the early 80s, and it's where I take a guy I'm seeing if I think he's really special. If the weather is nice, get an outdoor table facing Washington Square Park and people-watch. My only complaint is that service can be very slow. My friend and I were here for lunch once and waited almost 40 minutes for the check after we asked for it. I'll be forgiving since it was the day of the North Beach Jazz Festival, but that was really bad. Come for the food and the atmosphere.

bFVQxZzaqIrt8Ih9Ju8SPw.review_text: The bf & I were out for a long, rambling walk, & got hungry for something not-so-heavy.  Found this place via Yelp, & so glad we did!  It was about 8-8:30pm on a Sunday evening, & the place was steady, but still had several open tables.  Nice, mellow atmosphere.  We both got the meatball panini.. normally we'd try two things & share, but it sounded too good to share.  I got mine without onions, because when asked, the waitress advised that they weren't cooked (I'm not a huge fan of raw onions).  SOO yummy!  The bread was amazing!  The meatballs had wonderful fine, meaty texture & delicious flavor.  Lovely melted cheese.  And perfect serving size... enough to satisfy, but not overstuff.  And good beer.    Cozy, warm interior.. very classic, pretty small.  Nice neighborhood-y vibe (even though it's not our neighborhood, lol).  A perfect stop for a cozy bite & sip, alone or with another.

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: My friend and I stopped in over the weekend to grab a cup of coffee when it was downpouring.  Unsure of what would await us inside (cigars?  maybe something else?), we both ordered lattes, and they were pretty spectacular.  It's a great little nook in North Beach where you can mostly avoid the crowds of some of the other coffee shops.

aBfT6rp0tfhEyc7fWeuYJA.review_text: Mmmm.  Delicious foccacia sandwiches, unlike any I've had elsewhere.  Plus a great view of Washington square park, a bar to sit at if you're by yourself, and usually friendly staff.

ZBvgdepd6a_eRL9100jnvQ.review_text: I spent the weekend sick as a dog.  Awful.  I managed to stumble down the block in search of sunshine and sustenance and made it as far as Mario's, where I almost collapsed onto a barstool.  The friendly guys behind the counter took good care of me, and within minutes I was set up with a copy of The Onion and an absolutely delectable chicken sandwich.  Sweet!  Thanks, Mario's, for letting this Typhoid Mary inhabit your joint.  I'll definitely be back.  (PS:  I tried really hard not to cough...I swear...)

0NHFUcmVPIUTXn8hJzagNA.review_text: I didn't notice any cigar business going on here  I had a great experience here on a beautiful summer July evening.   Mario's is small, but has plenty of San Francisco charm that you'd expect in North Beach.  There's a nice mix of international and local folks that come here. Since I'm a music snob I noticed they had some reggae on the ipod which helped the laid back vibe. Hence the Bohemian in "Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store.  I ordered a Salomi, Jack cheese Panini and the GF grabbed the chicken pesto with sun dried tomatoes.  The sandwich is a decent size, and very tasty.  Great place for a glass of wine and some food.  FYI Take your parents here for lunch when they visit.  They'll love the Neighborhood

Nq79UljHwHu6y6W795_O9w.review_text: My favorite cafe in north beach, tasty sandwiches, friendly service, good beer and wine, and no pretension.  Their focaccia sandwiches are the best!

B3_3WVRuHGccKEPT5fbbdg.review_text: Good for coffee, paninis and sandwiches are pretty disappointing.  Add a side to the $10.50 sandwich and then we'll talk.

MS1N3m_RPWAghXBLR4OgkA.review_text: This place is fun...low key little neighborhood place that my sister recommended. We had yummy pizza. A fun little find.

gG6FFEEVRf9qu0cMqosSQg.review_text: I can't believe a cafe in SF doesn't have soy milk.  I had the espresso and it wasn't very impressive. My friend had a regular cappuccino and it was very clear that they don't know how to foam milk. Ironically there is not much good coffee in north beach.   We had one of their focaccia sandwich which was good but we were certainly expecting more from a such a historical place.

u6t-4eN6VEPRG85k3sKmaw.review_text: This has been my favorite hangout in the world since my first visit in 1973, the year the Crismani family took over the former "Bohemian Cigar Store" (which really did sell cigars), and i arrived in NB. it had been one of the several "Italian old men" coffee/wine bars in North Beach. they were all gone by the late '70's, the Portofino (where Cafe Roma is today) and others i can't remember the names. within months Mario kicked out all the old guys, took out their old Italian pinball machines, and completely shifted the customership to all us 20-somethings who were flooding into San Francisco and NB in the 70's, plus its many continuing beat-era denizens. very smart business plan, betting on the future. there were no windows on the Union Street side at all, those were added in the 80's. Mario kept a box of cigars under the counter to sell just in case someone wandered in and asked for one until he passed away in the 90's. at some point around then they had to take out the Foosball game in the back to add more tables because the landlord raised the rent a lot, also adding the sidewalk tables outside. but aside from such details it really hasn't changed at all. they have had the good sense not to redecorate or try to update. it still has one of the funkiest (but clean) bathrooms in town. Lilliana still bakes the pastries, the sandwhiches are tasty, and the servers are always very neighborhood-y. the generations of customers, servers, and passers-by shift with the years, but the place is timeless.  just thought i'd offer some history for context.

ksRdqPxR-of7gpnAD8JrZA.review_text: I come here at least twice a week. I love the food and everyone in there!! I say....it's a must!

rOOn-eWAaoSx-1omIO-KZw.review_text: coffee and wich, not much for me for a weekend lunch

dknykwweCpZFt6V_59wlvA.review_text: My husband was first here 15 years ago and he was hoping it was still there.....IT WAS!  What a great place.  Wonderful sandwiches....pannini and foccacia, and great beers.  They have a house Campari that my husband had....mmmmmmm!  Great staff, charming location, right on the corner in the North Beach area on Columbus.  So good!

2gV1sQgDbZHOvfPaewbYZg.review_text: A nice little spot near the greenery of Washington Square; perfect for catching the last sun of the day while sipping on a cold beer and munching on a petite slice of pizza.  Very shifting quality among their personnel though: sometimes service is good, sometimes service can be straight up horrible/non-existent.

hAA318ThgJmKWiHKhPX-Xw.review_text: This is review is based on service and service alone.    I guess its true, but the first impression is always important.  The fine customer service I received from Mr. Moustache can be rated at 1 star.    Why you may ask?  Where should I start with my list of adjectives, pretentious, sarcastic @hole, cocky, rude, and the list goes on.    Take your time and money elsewhere.    I hate it when decent north beach establishments become ruined because monkeys are giving aweful customer service.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: Mario's is fantastic! For the longest time, I thought they only served coffees. Then I realized they also served beer and wine. Then I realized that they also serve some of the best sandwiches in San Francisco...!  The foccacia sandwiches which range from about $7.75 to $9.50 are huge and amazing! I was particularly impressed with chicken #1 and the tuna sandwich but the grilled eggplant and grilled veggies were good too.  The panini sandwiches are a bit smaller and about $1 less and still great! The salads are also very fresh and I've heard that the pizza's are yummy.  The cappuccinos that I've had have been very good but the straight coffee's that I've ordered have been not as good... In terms of other beverages, they have lots of great wine starting at about $5 a glass (Dad complained that they weren't using "real" wine glasses outside... more like mini water glasses but I think he may have gotten a bigger pour than a wine glass!).  We stalked a group that were finishing their lunch and then grabbed their great table out in the sun. There aren't enough outside tables but it's great when you can get one!   I've also done take-out for dinner and their sandwiches maintain their amazing quality as they travel in perfect little cardboard boxes where they can't get squished!

bHKnWT6cUshsxBs9DLVHfQ.review_text: Mario's is a great neighborhood spot if you want a simple place to get affordable food and drinks and be able to talk. Doesn't sound like much to ask for, but these things are at a premium in this area.   The location is just far enough away from all the shit hole tourist traps with neon signs down the street so there's no real spillover. Every seat is a window seat and the people watching is great with the park right across the street.   If you're a guy over 4ft tall and have had a few Peronis, have fun trying to use the bathroom.

M271Ac7UKVaQ9U5AOvc_9A.review_text: Let's get something straight.  A hot tea and a latte should not cost $7.  Oh wait, it's because they overcharged and I didn't feel like bringing it up to them because we were in a rush to leave.  Just another regular coffee shop with some good people-watching seats overlooking Washington Square Park.  With so many other options in this area, Mario's doesn't rank high on my list.

wW_qpveJyFmG2KUuoIi3jg.review_text: I was at the bohemian cigar cafe we ordered I/2 hr later the waitress tells us she forgot to put in our order she laughs about it as her and co workers are drinking behind the counter she brings us the wrong drinks as we were still waiting than she's behind the bar eating toast and licking her fingers (gross)  finally our food comes after 45 mins ,it was only a tuna salad and a panini that was burnt we were the only ones eating. So it wasn't busy Never apologized asked if everything's ok. Never going back.

7At-2aosTzh6pJcQyMrubA.review_text: Went only cuz Molinari's was closed.   :( Pretty good sandwiches. Waited 30+ min for take out.

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: Crappy service. Sluggish workers that took like 20 minutes for a waiter to come by to provide the menu and then another 15 to get our orders.  Ugh.   With competing restaurants next door, down the street and around the corner, I could have went to another cafe with the similar theme and be served by them the time I got my beverages here!  Tea and coffee is mediocre and the prices for beverages and sandwiches are a bit above the norm, but with this kind of service, it is not worth it at all.  It is located on the corner of the main street Columbus, so it has a good amount of exposure for people to walk in.  As for me, I am definitely not coming back.  There are too many restaurants and cafe shoppes in this vicinity to simply explore!

Yb5sQ-UyHptOUJbQq0lo3A.review_text: BEST TUNA MELT IN THE WORLD....Seriously, no joke....I have been eating here for over 25 years (since I was just a little girl, getting my first hair cut next door).    Served open-faced on freshly baked focaccia bread, with swiss cheese and white onions, then cut into "fingers" about 1 inch by 3 inches that perfectly mold (and melt) in your mouth.  I have taken countless other people to Mario's and everyone agrees.....best tuna melt EVER...hands down...  Priced around $12, its not the cheapest tuna melt around, but its worth every penny

uDNkwTSWMsLMlfUKumKlXg.review_text: I love this place. Just a tiny bar at the corner of Columbus and Union that happens to serve kickass sandwiches and Moretti in a bottle. Ended up stranded here last week when it started pouring rain and i was without umbrella. Mario's is not a bad place to be stuck inside.   I must note that i have never purchased a cigar here, nor ever even seen a cigar here. I'm sure they are somewhere. I guess i have have a reason to go back.

ZZyrSR4pke-Qi7Ul9EVKxQ.review_text: Very cute Italian style coffee shop we stopped at to recharge.  They have a full selection of coffee drinks and beers as well as a great staff.  I wish I can give bonus points because they had a phone charger that they let me use.

HQLNCYvZS3-gYTGaGvOS9g.review_text: This is the best meatball sandwich I have ever had. That's an aggressive statement, but totally true.

-34NV3A5a5gcL-s8UH4KbA.review_text: When I am in North Beach (which is not often), this is the cafe that I will go to. Everyone who works there is so nice. Sweethearts.   If you get a chance, order the cheesecake. It's not even cheesecake. It's light and fluffy and an enormous piece of heaven. The wife of the owner couple makes this at home. Mm. I am thinking of heading over there later today just to get me some of that.  And... their sandwiches are amazing - no fuss, simple is better, high quality ingredients. The perfect place to spend a lazy few hours.

u3xVUab_KTM_ddu7ifeJhw.review_text: mario's is pretty cool.  no cigars here, but a very nice location serving good coffee, tiramisu, and hot sandwiches and pizza.  my favorite:  an anchor steam, a cappuccino, and tiramisu in the afternoon.  if it's warm enough, i'll take a seat on the sidewalk on the North side of the shop, which is fully shaded during the day.

eiTboCTfpX0t8mWXLwcwYQ.review_text: Tried this place about four times now and have mixed reviews. The sandwiches taste great, but on the pricy side for not coming with chips or a salad...they need to improved their customer service, it takes them a while to get to you for being such a small place...I will continue to go there when I'm not in a rush, the paninis are that good

Uzr6q-ad8aJ7OFzsx0tgyw.review_text: Used to be great. The service is awful. I wish the owner would hire more competent people.

VnzpoG3nClXrv41x5Mx0mg.review_text: Great cafe on the corner, North beach classic. Grab a seat outside or at the counter, try a meatball, sausage, or eggplant  focaccia sandwich.  (About $8.00) Love the pepperoncini on the side for that extra kick and goes down nicely with a peroni. Great spot for lunch or a great spot to film your music video like R&B singer Monica did back in the day. youtube.com/watch?v=Gx9c…

moatmEAhuR7u7PnYwhAvpQ.review_text: Eh. Was very excited to try out the food here, but mediocre service and bland food made this a 2-star review.   I had the Chicken Sandwich #1 ($6.50 for half, $11.75 for full) and it was disappointing. Barely any flavor, no spices, etc. I had a bite of my husband's meatball sandwich, and while it was better, it was still "eh". I really wanted to like this place, but oh well :(

oxweEEnMFLCIuFMZxv43hQ.review_text: I've been going here with my dad and my grandmom since I can remember. Every friend I've brought here has been impressed and wanting to come back! We only go here for the focaccia sandwiches. I've had all of the sandwiches on the menu, and my faves are probably the meatball and the chicken dijon.  I dont know how they do it, but the bread is just perfect. every. time. Crispy and oniony on the outside, with the perfect soft bread on the inside.  I've also had one of their salads before...I forget what it was called but there's slices of mozerella cheese and tomatoes, with spinach leaves, topped with pesto sauce. that was also pretty delicious.  I cannot get enough of this place. its a really cute, local little cafe at the corner across from Washington Square park. a great place to people watch!  Just to add a story to this post, I went in there with some friends one day, and this Italian guy was at the bar. he comes up to our table, pulls up a chair, and says to me "you look just like my ex girlfriend back home!" and we start up a conversation. It was fun, he was nice. A cool place to meet people too. haha.  Also a good thing: they open until 11pm!!!

bE5Swrp3qwsgA_SyVBUfbg.review_text: Perfectly satisfied with the meatball and the combination sandwiches. Meatball sandwich is pretty good. I ate the combination sandwich the day after, so it definitely is not as good as if it was eaten there. The focaccia bread is yummy, but it's really thick and 1 dimensional? I probably prefer a panini myself.  Tiramisu tastes amazing! I finish the entire dessert myself. I like how it's a bit wet and very flavorful.  I used a HomeRun voucher with me and there's a little bit of confusion on whether the expiry date has passed. He stared at the voucher for a good 10 minutes before giving me the americano and water. The owner doesn't seem too pleased with the voucher in general I'd guess, so I definitely advice against buying any vouchers for this place. And this is validated by another reviewer's crazy experience before mine!

uF5V6WYHa38TJU9LFQyjFQ.review_text: Amazing meatball sandwich, out of this world tiramisu, perfect coffee, and one completely hip and comfortable place!! Especially since all can be had for next to nothing!

kPeiNC7_wWsrkUynBl1-HQ.review_text: Ages ago a friend took me there and recommended the eggplant parmesan focaccia sandwich. It was so good that I've never been able to order anything else. About once a week (or more) I get this undeniable craving and HAVE to go. It's wonderful.   In addition I like the environment. It's never too crowded, the people working there are really mellow and friendly and it's got this nice patina of age. If their sandwich wasn't sublime, I'd probably still go there sometimes for a drink. But I'm glad that their sandwich exists.

HkPT4Y19Olqsmtvvnalw3A.review_text: Damn this spot is great. I suggest the Foccacia sammies or the tukrey and blue cheese panini and or the tomatoe mozzarella. My boyfriend eats two freakin sandwiches, which I cant even believe, But imt telling you, its ridiculously bomb and worth getting a parking ticket!! Great on a sunny day, or a " you just slept at my house, I dont really know you, but, eh, I wanna see what you are REALLY like," brunch

QIEgvzl1764XnHqW1enHyg.review_text: This is the real deal....if you like to relax in 'little Italy' and dream of Florence or Lucca whilst sipping a delicious cappuccino, look no further. It is small, intimate, old-style. And very European, very Italian. I knew Mario's while growing up in NB and it's barely changed; thank god. This sweet little cafe fronts beautiful Washington Square Park and corners busy Columbus Avenue...great for people watching. Order their absolutely wonderful meatball sandwich (or any for that matter). I adore this place. All is right in the world.

3gRykLgv5-_vxngoRlAFrQ.review_text: I discovered this place 7 years ago when I lived in north beach and even though I live in the mission I still make it over there whenever I can. There is something about those foccacia bread sandwiches that is so delicious. I have taken many different people there and everybody has loved the food. The mini pizzas are tasty too. I could eat the chicken sandwich #2 everyday. The atmosphere is great and coffe is strong, and on a nice day/night you can sit outside. My favorite place in North Beach by a mile.
