Minus one star because the waitress with the big eyes is kind of rude.

9aZJMOox-6E0W_pBnaVZlA.review_text: Man, that oniony foccacia bread is heavenly. I think I'd be happy if it were just a little toasted with big bowl of fruity olive oil. I've tried one of the chicken sandwiches and the meatball one and I prefer the latter. I'd say it's not a typical meatball sandwich though - it's most of a deconstructed meatball slash sausage sandwich. In any event, it's pretty good. (Sounds like the eggplant one should be next based on the other reviews...)  I like the relaxed vibe of the of place - the bartender/server guy was super friendly both times I dropped in. It's nice to know there's a mellow place to get a bite when you're too hungover to deal with anything that's remotely uncasual.

QR58q2KsjkTKzACr1JahHQ.review_text: I love Mario's.  It is an Italian style restaurant.  It has a bar and some of the best pizza and sandwiches on focaccia bread.  It is walking distance from Bimbo's.  Check out the International Bar across the street from Bimbo's.  That is a regular spot for me and it's where most people go when they leave Bimbo's.  The bartenders are friends of mine.

qoYZ6QbVczMo3Dtyaeubhg.review_text: Lovely little cafe overlooking Washington Square. From the comfort of your seat, while sipping delectable hot chocolate, you can see the bronzed yoga man in nothing but shorts on a cold day, dog walkers pretending not to notice when their dog takes a shit, and random children playing (not sure I knew children actually existed in this city)  Good food, interesting people watching, and a nice respite from the usually touristy North Beach.  Note: Not actually a cigar store. Don't go in here thinking you'll pick up some Cubans on the down low. Not gonna happen.

sFP8CNt6hFqepeiuqgj6fg.review_text: intimate feel, fast service, the menu is simple an straight to the point, all components to a good spot. I had the tuna sandwich here today, definitely worth it. Stop by have a Peroni on me.

uKd-4aCc2ud8Sum1fjYRfA.review_text: I loved this place. We only went in for a cup of coffee but the experience was great. The cakes looked amazing. My favorite part was the 2 servers behind the bar. They were hilarious (you know who you are handle bar stache). Plus the latte was amazing, best I had had in years.

nb5Q_TnCH8CjgjWDaCDVvg.review_text: What a fantastic little place! Great service, super food and drinks, and so affordable. My friend and I split the spicy tuna foccacia and prosciutto baguette (both daily specials and FANTASTIC), hummingbird IPAs, and coffee drinks and got out of there for less than $20 each. Our server was even kind enough to give us public transportation directions to our next location on the back of a napkin. The other server even gave us some gum after our strange combination of food and drink - much appreciated!

_4SntAIQYfGdPtWdTBUTHQ.review_text: This is one hell of a little fantastic place to grab a drink and a quick gnosh. The sandwiches and pizza are pretty effin great.  I even saw the bartender carefully take down a poster from the wall and give it to a customer because the customer liked it.   Deliciously San Franciscan. Don't miss out.

cCeCQxErE9ToaQQBEVFuFA.review_text: on a crisp cold afternoon we (mostly meaning I) was starvin and looking what would crave my hunger. my boss had told me to try this out, so the bf and I headed on over. love the feel in the place; comfortable, homey, and right across the park for some good dog watching :) we split the caesar salad- romaine fresh and crunchy, croutons were just perfect, shaved parm, and the dressing, although lightly dressed, was absolutely delicious. tasted just like our homemade version. for the main parts- i got the meatball sandwich, him - the salami panini. i really enjoyed the marinara and the meatballs. they were fluffier, probably had a good amount of bread in them. the bread on both sandwiches were just awesomeness, asked the server and told us they get it from Bakers of Paris. his salami panini had that meaty slightly spicy thing going for it. pretty good prices too.

bt4pSBah2St9nWoBB-EOAQ.review_text: $15 after tip for a rather unforgettable meatball sandwich that was overhypped as hell does not qualify as one $ nor good eats.  Service was adequate, but there's no reason to make a trek out here for an average sandwich.  Go to Ike's instead.

ydSrLLpFSl9oYcTUtJnbaA.review_text: I've lived in S.F. for over 20yrs and would come here at least once a month. I moved away but still have to stop by here every time I visit my family to get my meatball sando fix. Bar None the best meatball Sandwich ever. I sit at the bar, order an Anchor Steam and feel like I never left. The staff is great, they remember me and address me by name, which is amazing.

CNw5B3BBhTbOlrOlS1meEA.review_text: Despite the unappetizing name, the sandwiches here are good, especially the eggplant or meatball panini. Add a cold beer and you have a very filling lunch.

Ven8UIY0u3Jxqa_V9p021g.review_text: Another local treasure I'm prone to sit in for hours. Its really not about the food, its about the people. Its about the space, the place, the close proximity to Bimbo's. Its about people watching, and listening in (or joining in) on conversations and the bar is easy to lean against.

qXTZ2Ffu-Esa3I3F7u9HrA.review_text: OOOOH MY GOOOOOD Yeah baby.... MMMMMM MMMMM  This is the place to go for a huge meatball sandwich and a slice of tiramisu  the meatball sandwich comes with flavorful tender meatballs in a rich mild tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese enclosed within two fresh slices of foccacia bread. This sandwich was huge and definitely you will have leftovers.  Have a slice of their tiramisu. Creamy, fresh, lightly sweet and delicious.

oxl--iAcvMX2RWSqGZXcfQ.review_text: I've passed by this place a bunch of times and finally stopped in for a quick bite before lounging in the park. I walked right in and started chatting with the guy behind the bar/kitchen that was making sandwiches and pizzas. Found out they do take out so I ordered up a chicken panini and coffee and continued chatting. The space is super cozy and had I not wanted to soak up some sun, I probably would have stayed to eat my sandwich there.  The sandwich itself wasn't anything spectacular. It wasn't bad, it wasn't excellent...just meh. I did see a plate of sausage and polenta that got me drooling, so maybe I'll just go back and sample that? Yes.  Also, I asked for a coffee and they offered me an americano instead. I mean, yeah, I get it. Same concept, but I feel like I ended up spending more money.

LwJuBvnmCPWxyaCVO6L_PA.review_text: The first bar I went to when I moved here four years ago.  I will never forget Amor, Nelson and Heiyme (sp?) = the bartenders.  You want a mellow, chill night? Get drunk and enjoy a salad and paninni at Mario's

2hHZVnE1WThvDU3Y3jNjTA.review_text: Good sandwiches servered heated out of the oven on local bread, good views of Washington PArk in North Beach.  Very small, best if its just for two.  TIP: get your sando to go and eat in the grass across the street.

HFECrzYDpgbS5EmTBtj2zQ.review_text: Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store is one of the oldest cafes in North Beach, (and maybe the US) and was founded by Mario Crismani and his wife, Liliana. They serve oven baked Focaccia Sandwiches (and other Italian fare), beer, wine, coffee, great desserts, but no cigars.  Gayle and I have been here on a date, and were lucky to find a table at this very compact and authentic corner space. It's also cool to see Washington Square park across the street and watch the world (including a few Bohemians of course) go by. The food was good, the service was "direct", the energy was exciting, and the decor was homey. In other words, it's a real North Beach neighborhood experience.

45QGl0zmMCBTR8xK43yNEw.review_text: Yummy!! This place is unbelievable. My hubby and I have been coming for years when we are in the city. Try the Meatball focaccia sand which and for the veggie in your life go with the eggplant.   The staff is fantastic even if they don't acknowledge you right away... It's probably because they are pouring a stiff glass of wine or making you some kick ass food.   Be a cool kid and go here!! If you dint your a fool. ;)

oDUwWXVtVN8YFivMfFK1hw.review_text: This place is the perfect little hole in the wall. It always has a crowd, but never the overly busy feel to it. It is a very cozy corner shop with friendly staff, beautiful focaccia bread and a diverse crowd of tourists, regulars and passersby.

0wT8cxKg9WN3Xhf3vbN-tA.review_text: I LOVE this place!  My husband brought me here on one of our dates and we always go back to it when we go to the City.  The owner is very nice!

Cp3i9koV3ryHFQ8CM764zw.review_text: Between three and four stars and pushing the culinary limits of what's possible with a glorified toaster oven. Mario's limited menu is consistently decent and they do panini, focaccia and small thin sliced pizza well. Good place for a simple meal, beer or wine, or coffee drink. Check out the photos on the wall of the family, including the original owner excelling in bocce ball and looking like the Soprano's Feech LaManna and son who is a dead ringer for ex Pittsburgh Steelers head coach Bill Cowher. A fine and authentic, low key, North Beach vibe.

jAes_OPpvQy-cnmctqRqwg.review_text: Cool spot, cool area, friendly, on-the-ball service and good food. Definitely worth a visit if youre nearby or on a regular basis if you live close.

H96D8BoF4e24MMSnxXZdMg.review_text: The meatball focaccia is very good - but had to wait 45 minutes to get it. As soon as we got our food, we took it to go as paying $4 / hr for parking just doesn't warrant me sitting around waiting for food for that long.  No one said - your food will be about 30-40 minutes.

CII7ZpjbiSM_m_C62QkfAA.review_text: Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store Cafe is a great place to the following...  - Get lit at the bar and make small talk with people.  - People watching on the outside tables.  - Drinking coffee and/or eating very good focaccia bread inside on a nice day.  Great place to bring a party of 2 or more.

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: It really can feel like like Europe on a lazy weekday afternoon in North Beach and we're not talking about the number of tourists. Sitting out in the sunshine at Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store Cafe overlooking Washington Square Park is a nice staycation thing to do.   Now to be honest the food isn't that special. You can get better sandwiches elsewhere but the charm isn't really the food. I've had paninis here before but more often than not, I end up just grabbing a nice cold beer to relax and watch the day go by. It's a take it slow kind of place. Service here is never hurried so it complements the whole kick-back experience.   Come for the experience and relax, take your time, and enjoy.

qVCGzJCDnjwut1dnHef2Og.review_text: No Cigars but great food. They use Foccacia bread and the meats for the sandwiches are delicious.  Definitely GO!!

9Wrg-nTHQtM7KFn_legxow.review_text: The panini here are fantastic. It's the perfect spot for a quick lunch or dinner. But let's be honest. There's a lot of other reasons they get 4 stars: the name, the view of Washington Square, Moretti Rosso in a bottle, the old North Beach bar. You can't go wrong at Mario's.

0YSBWd176lBnRUHDmwgQcg.review_text: it pains me to blast marios with a 1 star review because their food is good but.... Last time i ate there i ordered a chicken panini to go and while i waited for the guy to make it I watched him (with one glove on) sweep the floor, put his hand in the trash, touch multiple other dirty surface's with both hands then proceed to handle my sandwich and garnishes with unwashed hands with one glove still on. I dont mind cleaning up while you wait. but for f@cks sake wash your hands and put on clean gloves before you handle someones food. Especially if they are standing right there watching you the whole time. Based on this one experience I unfortunately will never return to this establishment.

QEXU4HcSdqkeTPM6BXp1iw.review_text: Food is good not great. Ambiance is great not good.

ndcKCKVhlFs_h2rTE8gMGg.review_text: LOVE IT ALL!!  I've had pizza, and chicken panini's.I haven't tried their meat ball sammich but I hear its great!  My FAV is the TUNA sandwich- with melted cheese, tomatoes and a side of salad, which they are definitely generous with their portions. The staff is AMAZING- not only is overall service a PLUS, they make you feel like family. That's what keeps me coming back to this place. My fiance and I love going to Cobb's comedy club so we always make sure to stop by and grab a bite before the show, and come back for drinks after.   Overall it's a chill place to go on any occasion. Rain or shine, Mario's is a perfect place to go solo or with a small group of friends...

T5T_SAuW2uFuiJNQ--mtKg.review_text: I never knew about this place until my younger sister suggested meeting here for lunch before we headed to Pier 39.  The cafe is pretty casual and cozy.  Even though the service is a tad slow, still it's a nice place to relax, enjoy the scenery (if one is sitting by the window) and carry on a conversation without a lot of noise around.     Since my sister has been here before, she mentioned that the sausage and meatball with marinara sauce on onion foccacia bread were the "bomb".  Instead I opted for the smoked turkey & pepperjack sandwich with my usual...an Arnold Palmer.  Reading over the menu,  I have to say everything sounded delish.  Thus, it will be more visits to this cafe in the future to taste the meatball, breaded eggplant sandwiches and the tiramisu listed under Italian sodas.  My smoked turkey sandwich (piping hot and fresh) with the pepperjack cheese oozing from the side and the hint of dijon mustard was yummy.  It was a nice balance without any flavors overpowing each other.  However, my expectation for an Arnold Palmer was a tall glass filled partly with iced tea and then topped off with lemonade.  Yes, the beverage came in a tall glass, but I was caught off guard and slightly disappointed that it was a bottle of Snapple Arnold Palmer (3 star).  I guess that's why the Arnie Palmer was listed at a price of $2.25.

292O6zybNDXGcVG6F1Frbw.review_text: molto bene!  my mozzerella/tomato/pesto panini hit the spot and i enjoyed the cozy atmosphere of the bar area.  plus, i was transported to and from mario's via scooter, which only served to complete my italian moment.  grazie mille!

0QA8_53vKf8Vzn7S65sOnw.review_text: This used to be a good bar/cafe, now, it's just historic.  Still its a decent, only semi-touristy place to take your out of town visitors for a relatively inexpensive lunch of foccacia sandwiches.

AWN20sIwFrjG_NIkDrIAlQ.review_text: i've been coming to mario's since 1994.  it's one of those places where time basically stands still.  it's old school like that.  the decor, the attitude of the folks working there, the patrons...it's got that no b.s., no fronting vibe that only a few north beach spots still have nowadays.  and it's not obsolete in any way.  what worked so well then still holds up today.  excellent paninis.  solid coffee drinks.  inexpensive, not cheap, wine served in gibraltar glasses.  music plays at a volume level that allows for conversation.  bartenders/baristas/servers are attentive and friendly, but without any fake friendly that so frequently passes for customer service nowadays.  the cafe gets great light and is a fantastic place to while away an afternoon.

SCqvfTpB9QhKEIlKDrwC6Q.review_text: Don't be fooled by the name of this place --- the focaccia sandwiches here are so yummy!!!  My favorite is the breaded eggplant.  One tiny drawback is that I think prices went up slightly and the sizes also look a bit smaller.  But I'll still come here to eat!  A great place for take-out to eat at Washington Square Park across the street on a sunny day.

QKSIsCkY834vb6Z1SH-Dyg.review_text: Tasty sandwiches!  We had the meatball foccacia sandwich and a salad.  The foccacia was toasted to perfection and the meatballs were perfectly seasoned.  Yum-O as Rachael Ray likes to say.  (Okay, she totally bugs.)   The salad was good too, but nothing to write home about.  The waitstaff seemed quirky, but very friendly.

mYHXFms1TY4vZCcoVTGVqg.review_text: Bad food, worse wine, good time

7TGoPZcVuiQFuHK2WFykKg.review_text: I have been eating at Mario's for years.  As big, and I mean BIG a pain as it can be to find parking in the area, it is well worth the effort.  Cozy up the to bar and have a beer while perusing the simple but well done menu.  I love the combination focaccia sandwich.  They buy the focaccia fresh every morning from a focaccia bakery right across Washington Square.  I have heard the vegetarian sandwich is really good too.  It is a family owned business and they treat customers really well.  I know of a couple of generations of families who frequent Mario's.  Suck it up and deal with the parking.  It will be worth it.

mAhty2OHDTtLm00quB5Xjw.review_text: 5* for Elizabeth and Brian's lovely Festivus party here! Look forward to coming back to see what they serve in this charming little annex of a cafe.

K1oh2YuJghc-pdjfWfVqTg.review_text: A real Bohemian cafe with cool staff! Not a typical cafe...try their cappuccino!

Bjah16Vlkk6ocxFTfL5G9Q.review_text: Meatball sandwich is the bomb! Sit outside, drink a beer, eat a sandwhich, and contently watch the world go by. Great place!

n-eYeIpSTiKhoDeubO1mmA.review_text: I got my karmic payback for making light of herpes the other day.   You see, shortly after making fun of the social disease, I sprouted a pimple on the inside of my lip, and anyone who's ever had any sort of blemish or bump or whatever inside their mouth knows that they can hurt like a bitch!   So it was without thinking of this ailment that I bit into a pepperocini while at Mario's. OH GOD DAMMIT TO HELL THAT BURNS! I shoved the generous portion of the offending pickled peppers to the side of my plate.   I took a bite of my heapingly huge foccacia sandwich (your choice of fillings: chicken, eggplant, sausage, you name it!) as the crusty corner of the deliciously perfect foccacia brushed against my lip-pimple. OWW! OH GOD, OK, I WON'T MAKE JOKES ABOUT PEOPLE'S LIP & COOCHIE SORES ANYMORE. AND I WON'T USE YOUR NAME IN VAIN. PLEASE, JUST MAKE IT STOP.   But it was so good, I continued to eat.   Thank you, Mario, for serving up delicious food, a very cozy and homey atmosphere, and lessons in karmic retribution and humility before god.   Note to those confused by the name of the business: The food is not Bohemian in any way, and while cigars are sold, they cannot be smoked here. If anything, it's more of a casual Italian restaurant and wine bar with a dark, homey atmosphere that could've once been a den of cigar-smoking and backroom deal-making.

_gkHU53dyXy6GxK6AX-b0A.review_text: Stumbled upon this place at about 2 on a Monday afternoon while looking for a quick and yummy bite after visiting Alcatraz and climbing way up to Coit Tower. It was the perfect spot to plop down and kick back and relax for a few and, upon walking in, you could tell it was a neighborhood classic.  The staff was super-friendly. When my girlfriend inquired about their Sabu Bloody Mary they told her it wasn't very good - honesty is the best policy, right? Instead, we ordered a couple Anchor Steams and waited for our food. The bathroom was unique but clean and funny to use.  I ordered the smoked turkey hot focaccia sandwich which was perfectly grilled and delicious. It was served with a great cucumber salad and pickle. My girlfriend ordered the eggplant pizza which was delicious as well (although the crust seemed oddly similar to frozen pizza crust).  Prices were fairly good, although on the high end but the personality the place has totally made up for it. Overall, loved it!!

cUVXN2NZX2wEseNfHcetQg.review_text: I may be biased but I only ordered a Latte at this place. Why am I giving it four stars then? The coffee was perfect, the temperature was perfect (read: did not burn my lips) and the decor is funky. I'd go here to read a book if I lived in San Fran.

CKT1MbZxKNWtSpj7qINn-A.review_text: i took the 30 bus back to work, but wanted to stop for some lunch.  i had my heart set on giordano bros for some sandwiches, but i friggin' missed the stop.  so i looked out the window and saw focaccia bread sandwiches scrawled on the window.  FOCACCIA!!! I LOVE FOCACCIA!  it was late afternoon and hardly crowded at all, but i swear could they have been any slower??  i was starving, and i did not enjoy the fact there was nothing else on the menu you could munch on along with the sandwich. minus one star.  i got my sausage with marinara and swiss focaccia sandwich, it smelled great and looked great, but for $10.00 including tax and tip.  UH... not so great.  i felt it was missing something, like a kick!  it was a bit bland, i was looking for lots of flavors on many levels.  it fell short. minus last star, BUT I Must say that the focaccia bread was delish!  maybe this place is more of a beer/wine joint.  i will not be returning.  i'd prolly go back to giordano bros a couple of blocks down if i were to get a sandwich in north beach. :) smiles tho

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: It took a while as my order was briefly lost in the shuffle, but when my open-faced veggie sandwich finally arrived, it was so worth the wait. This calorie depleted yelper, who was just a few hours removed from a 4+ hour epic with Markus Schulz, went right to work.  This focaccia-grilled veggies-marinara sauce creation stood no chance, and as I reflected on last night's show, already being referred to in the text/Facebook world as "best night ever", I found the sandwich enhancing my mood even more.  Brilliant weekend. Brilliant sandwich.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: This place reminds me of the cafe's they have in Europe. It's a one-stop shop for all your indulgent needs. Need a drink but also a hot meal? Done. Need a drink but can't unless you get a smoke? Done. Need espresso and a quick pastry? Done. Need all of the above? Done and done.   I have yet to have the food here but the panini's looked amazing. The wine selection is not great so don't come here thinking you're going to get Amelie style wines (not that you would - I hope!). Next time I'll stick with beer; you can never go wrong with a Stella.   I also want to note the generosity of the bartender who gave us a round for free towards the end of the night. Good shiz.

fU-8n2G_hT1vv45W9k6Htw.review_text: I used to love this place,  but wow the service has become terrible.  I came in this week and it took me 20 minutes just to get a drink while I was at the bar!   After that my sandwich was completely burnt.  We go in today for a drink with a big group, we were there for literally one minute and the waitress started yelling at us for being in the way.   POOR SERVICE.  It's really too bad, lot of potential but poor service.  I unfortunately have to recommend that you stay away from this place until they right the ship.

1weX1NNnTFjaRzQHJKhCuw.review_text: I just visited for 4 hours last night with a colleague/friend...and found this to be a charming little spot. Love it! The place is pretty cozy and feels like your own personal cafe when you walk in....very friendly, familiar, charming...  Simple menu which is awesome---simple wine list, again, no problem. I don't do or need fancy-shmancy. My friend told me try either the tuna, sausage, meatball or eggplant panini....now I usually delve into meat options but I'm a huge fan of eggplant so I opted for that and an unlimited amount of Malbec.... SO GOOD! The bread...incredible, the flavors in the eggplant, wow, hearty.... I tried his tuna.... SO GOOD! WIN!   ***note, the amount of Malbec had no influence whatsoever on the rating of the food, promise!***  The server was a really nice character who poured our last glass on the house.... don't know if that meant he was really being gratuitous or if it was because we almost finished the bottle... :) Who cares! It was great.   And the neighborhood is a gem to walk around after... apparently there is a great gelato spot nearby... possibly my next review??

LksuiNKspbDOZYNOkDx1bA.review_text: Love this place!! I woke up this Saturday with no real plans for the morning/early afternoon and wandered to Marios for a cup of coffee and a foccacia sandwich. Reading the newspaper while eating the #2 grilled chicken sandwich (request it open faced!) was the best way to spend this relaxing, sunny Saturday.   Mario has a very attentive staff and great food, although I found myself walking past it for several months before walking in and trying it out. It isn't ideal for large groups, but a great place for intimate coffee or brunch/lunch time w/ friends. The ideal seating would be the front table away from the draft that comes from opening and closing the door.   Again, I recommend the coffee, espresso (strong!) and grilled chicken sandwich open faced. The caprese salad would be more delightful sans the pesto sauce but other than that, I've heard good things about their other sandwich and panini options.

lBaoq2G8xXrSX_esMQXM-A.review_text: Mario's is typically not a place I would have tried in SF but our favorite bartender at Vesuvio's recommended it when asked where can we get a good sandwich.  The name alone (containing Cigar) would have been enough to make me think not.  Food and smoke don't settle well with me unless we are talking BBQ.  Asking a local is always a good idea because you usually end up with great food at inexpensive prices.  Mario's was one of those places.  Don't overlook Mario's, give it a try, you will be pleasantly surprised.

W_07r13S-cTjPxsd169KYg.review_text: I MAKE my friends who live in San Francisco take me here when I visit.  For those of you who know how hideous the parking is in North Beach,  you KNOW this is a favor akin to Sophie making her "choice."  I won't wax, but their meatball sandwich makes me believe in God (and I mean capital "G").  I airship these to my father, they're that good.  I can't say more.  It's too intense.

zaBX3i2WgmixzgQBwA33GA.review_text: When you come to North Beach...you usually have 2 things on your mind...1) girls 2) itallian food. Well this place offers up some THE BEST Italian Panini Sandwiches you will find in SF.   Let's start off with the bread...onion focaccia bread, because as we all know it's the bread that makes the sandwich. Perfectly toasted, flavor pops in your mouth.  All their sandwiches are amazing...but their sausage panini...soooooo good.   I ended up ordering the cannelloni...which was AMAZING! Their mix of spinach, cheese, veal, and chicken in a marinara sauce...wow...too bad they only give u 2 :(. I was still hungry so I ordered up a sandwich...best choice I've made in my life.   DEFINITELY RECOMMEND COMING HERE!!!

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Damn good lasagna!  This is a quaint restaurant/ bar that's no frills, but in a good way.  It's quiet enough to actually have a conversation in this joint, yet not quiet in a boring way.  The server/bartender was really nice.  And, when my dumb ass left the restaurant, forgetting my credit card on the table, he ran outside to give it to me.  Now that's good service.

t8aJIHxkutRlWMRNSvpq6w.review_text: So, today for lunch my boyfriend and I were looking for a place, and as we tried to go to Mama's (yet again, but an absurd line), we almost went to our usual standby Cafe Divine, but we decide to go to this place instead.  We walked in and sat down, and the first thing I noticed was the cool place.  I was just digging sitting there.  I think it would be a great place to go and just have some coffee or a beer or something and hang out.   We sat by the window and had a great view of the park.  We browsed the menu and I decided on the meatball focaccia sandwich, and he wanted the sausage sandwich.  Mostly so we could just share and each try half of a sandwich.  I had some coffee and we just sat there and enjoyed the atmosphere, the music, and the view.  The food came, and it was pretty darn good.  I think the meatball sandwich was better than the sausage sandwich, but I was happy with both of them.  The focaccia is great too, I don't think they make it there, but it was tasty!    I'd definitely go back for lunch sometime.  There were several other sandwiches on the menu I wanted to try, and the coffee wasn't bad either!  More than anything, I just loved the atmosphere, the view, the company, and the food!  I guess that's everything there!

lNSkba_B8yrvpEuHAi7mXw.review_text: Mmmmmm.  Great staff, great food and great location makes for great times.  Perfect for lunch.

MzXPOK2_T5O8GF-4qUVmGA.review_text: A North Beach institution.  Back in the day, Food & Wine magazine put the breaded eggplant sandwich @ Mario's on their list of "the 10 things you MUST eat in SF."  This was way, WAY before 7x7 magazine came out w their first list, since 7x7 magazine didn't even exist then.  I had to mention this because there are so many newbie "foodies" out there that actually don't know that there were lists like this & that there was a thriving food scene in SF long before "the 7x7 list" ever appeared.  Even worse, there are droves of people that use "the list" as the deciding factor on where & what to eat in this town.  And that's just sad.  SF has been cranking out exceptionally noteworthy food forever, & Mario's has been doing it from day one.  The skinny...  Yes, they used to sell cigars.  Heck, the place used to be filled w smoke when you walked in, when smoking inside was still legal.  When the non-smoking law started, they still sold cigars, just no more smoking.  An espresso here is iconic.  They make a mean cappuccino.  It's written up in many a travelers guide.  We're talking internationally.    The breaded eggplant is just as awesome now as it was way back when.  Only now many peeps seem to love the grilled eggplant just as much.  I say yes to both; let your mood decide or order a 1/2 of each.  Standouts... The chicken.  The meatball.  The sausage.  The tuna.  The veggie.  The turkey.  The combo (ham & salami).  Yes, they're actually all great.  No joke.  Basically, if you haven't had a focaccia sandwich from Mario's, preferably right out of the oven & piping hot w the requisite pepperoncinis...then you just haven't lived.  And that's their focaccia sandwich out of the OVEN; NOT a panini from the panini press.  There's just no comparison.  Trust.  The house made tiramisu is THE BEST in NB.  No contest.  Sometimes the service is great, sometimes it's not great.  But the tunes playing are always great.  Always.  So, just tune the service out if need be & enjoy everything else.    An institution.  Mangia.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: Driving around the city looking for a place open at 3pm for food! HUNGRY!! Ended up walking around Northbeach and walked right into this place seeing that it was crowded, must be good right? The staff was very nice, young guys hype and charming, mocha came out mmm it was good but could be a tad hotter. Ordered the meatball hot sandwich and caprese salad. The pesto on the Caprese salad was to die for! Soaked up every last drop with extra bread! The sammys took an hour to come out! YES an HOUR! man lucky the staff was real nice or I would of bitten their arms off I was so hungry! The sammy was yummy. Goey cheese, good meatballs and delicious focacia bread with green onions Oh my ! I would go back just for that focacia. I had a quarter of my friend's eggplant sammy and it was just OK, it was too salty for me. I love eggplant sammys, I've had better. It was good, if I lived in the hood I would be there alot. Since I'm not at NB too often I don't know when I'll be back.

aea3PTk1cMMV7UTh9HXINA.review_text: Mario's is bella bella. Wonderful atmosphere to sit and sip brews with friends. The decor is vintage, and I hate to say it but it sort of feels like a "Central Perk" type neighborhood place. I love it.  The paninis? Oh heaven! Just make sure you're not too drunk to enjoy it, and make a note to let it cool down. I burned my mouth numerous times because I was too impatient to wait till the melty-hot, obscenely delicious creation cooled down.

8D-HrtrDZZrH5_URNAAUHA.review_text: One of the best places in northbeach to much on some amazing sandwiches, punctuated with awesome Italian sodas. The staff is awesome. Very accommodating and nice. I loved the music too that was being played in the background just in the right volume. Thank u guys for a wonderful afternoon!

pgHCj7DSqI8NWx7WucnH3w.review_text: I really wanted to give this place 4 stars.  I even witheld writing my initial review, because having only had beer and wine the first time, I felt it was unfair to review it without having actually eaten here. Not only did we get very affordable (though average at best) drinks, we even got a free round from one of the bartenders. Much appreciated.  However after wandering back here on a beautiful sunday afternoon to try one of their delicious looking foccacia sandwiches, I have to settle on giving Marios 3 stars.   Marios is a nice little place that offers a little bit of everything. Food, drink, coffee...the only problem is that they don't particularly stand out in any one of these categories. Don't get me wrong, nothing here is bad and the atmosphere is quite nice, but you'll most likely leave Mario's thinking "well, it was pretty good, but not great..."  Pretty good service, pretty good food, pretty good drinks...but nothing stands out.  So while I can't fault them or say anything negative I have to give them a somewhat neutral review.  In short: Mario's is a tease which entices you into thinking that it will totally put out, but when it comes down to it never seals the deal.

eKrVnlMkBLXc3LCnQqX4Jg.review_text: First thing, don't go there expecting cigars.  The food is fantastic, if a little expensive ($8 for a sandwich).  Meatball and balsamic chicken foccacia sandwiches are personal favorites.  Outdoor seating is nice, just make sure you're sitting directly in the sun.  A great place to take friends from out of town or to have lunch in between Washington Square Park hangouts.

PZfAMbDJjmO_yZsCWm4oqg.review_text: A meatball sandwich like you've never had.  Simply da best!

_9s6vNpPyxBWwACbt32_Uw.review_text: I don't  normally give 5 stars, but this place deserves it.  The eggplant panini was phenomenal.  The espresso is excellent.  The people are friendly.  The place is small and cozy with great ambiance.  They were pretty jammed so it took 20 min for the food to arrive, but it was well worth it.

ySnJRrXNpbHuGYsm5mEAVA.review_text: Such a warm and enticing little North Beach spot! I spent a rainy Sunday afternoon just hanging out here and loved it! Good beer, food and coffee. Great views of Columbus St. and Washington Square Park. The small space, with lack of tv's, makes the place pleasantly comfortable and homey.

m9m06NCYDlSpes08U0r3Xg.review_text: I'm a meat guy- so for a portabello mushroom sandwich to knock me over and kick my ass several times as I pleaded for more is a giant leap of vegetarian faith...and that's exactly what happened:  me, first bite- whoa- I fall over on the floor and let  the pummeling begin.  The foccacia bread alone- I could just have a bread sandwich, I believe they get it from that mom n pop shop just down the road.  Anyway- I'm headed down to SF this weekend and I look forward to another beating.

BwFEjsr9yLqdszAmAxFYQg.review_text: DATE/TIME: April 7, 2011 / 1:00pm PRICE: $12-$18 AMBIANCE: Quaint, rustic, and a bit small. To use the word "interior design" to refer to the mix of wooden chairs and tables in the place would not be appropriate. It's definitely unpretentious. CHANCE OF RETURNING: 40% NOTE: The following review was written in May 2011 but never posted. ___________________________________ A HomeRun took me here on 4/7/2011, and I probably won't be back unless they've implemented some major changes or improvements to their menu. What kind of a place in North Beach can justify offering a whopping total of TWO wines, without any clarification of year or vintner until we prodded further and asked for a bottle. [UPDATED 3/15/13: It looks like they might have improved their menu a bit.  Also, since I last dined there, I've noticed that many TV shows with episodes or scenes that are meant to be set in SF tend to show the facade of Mario's Bohemian. I wonder if they think this is the ideal representation of our diverse city. If so, how disappointing. There was even an episode of House of Lies that had a scene with Jeannie (Kristen Bell) hooking up with a musician there. Well, it was a version of Mario's that looked nothing like the real thing.] In reality, the best thing about this place is its location and proximity to Washington Square Park. And sure, the meatball sandwich is worth a try. ___________________________________ :::: [ THE SPREAD ] :::: * MEATBALL SANDWICH (yelp.com/biz_photos/mari…)              - [4/5 - Tender well-flavored meatballs with a melted mozarella cheese on foccacia bread.] * LASAGNA              - [3/5 - I *love* lasagna. Throughout my childhood, almost every time I went out for Italian food, I would always order the lasagna. I'm not sure if I came here on an off day, but their lasagna was very well flavored, but a bit chewy and even a little on the greasy side.]

30l6PviyQqfH0qVC5Vu7MQ.review_text: Mmmmm, almost $10 for a sandwich? Alone? With nary a side to be seen? (Well, there MIGHT have been a pickle. I don't recall, to be honest.) The frugal diner should steer clear. Also, the Frommer's-toting traveler who's not from Lilliput. My guide suggested that the BCSC's "large" sandwiches were best enjoyed across the street in the park, but I chose to stay indoors and close to the counter, lest my far-from ample meal attract the gaze and titters of passersby. That, and it was dark out. And possibly raining.  At least the ladies working the counter were a hoot.

TLzwLBhPoO33w85VOXz97g.review_text: if it's a nice lazy weekend, strolled around the North Beach is my favorite thing. I just love it. I don't mind so much for tourists because I still feel and remember the feeling, when I was here for my first time in SF.  I like almost every where in NB, but MBCC is one of my favorite joint.   The place isn't fancy, very easy going and relaxing. This is a great place for beer and little food. We had: Cannelloni  $10.50, great hot out of the oven.  Mario's Salad  $6.50, this is pretty big for 6.50. like the dressing. Peroni on tap  $5, Nice Icy 1 pint great Italian beer. Espresso $1.75, I was a bit drunk by the great Peroni, so have a cup of Americano was a good idea. it was great strong a cup of Americano that kept my rest of the day going.  OMG, What a boring review! I'm sorry but the review is true. We were loving it. Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store Cafe. What a Great place!

NJkKim1vaowyEKtazPdByw.review_text: House Campari.  Four bucks.  Best cocktail deal in North Beach.

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots. Always great sandwiches, the  meatball is my favorite.  Service is always friendly. Always a welcoming place

F5PeWdJZqT8BAQD7LnY6_Q.review_text: Some of the best sandwiches in the neighborhood! The bread comes from the focaccia bakery a few blocks over, by far the best bread I've ever had so it adds a lot to the sandwiches. The grilled sandwiches are the best, my favorite is the chicken #1. The guys that run it are super old school and refuse to do any substitutions but you really wouldn't want any!

8-cYaX4GPkH3EtEeGfVNIQ.review_text: The sandwich, #1 Chicken, was very good. The bread was soft unlike most places and there was a lot of melted cheese. Overall, very good.   My problem with the place and the reaosn why I wont return is the price. To spend nearly $13 with tip on just a sandwich is just too much considering the prices at Dimaggios a couple doors down arent much different for a sandwich. I would at least expect some chips or something on the side. And, no, I dont count the two jalopenos they give as a side item.

Ogtdt1vzFXT5dDdfR-E7rw.review_text: Tasty Barolo /  Religous Focaccia /  Cute Peeps, no cigars.

7kmlaGMjjCHN8rL8oncz_A.review_text: after two years, and all my hangouts either closed, changed hands, or whatever ... good coffee, warm surroundings, and decent snacks

IlYuwBxMyt-WN9pIwklhgg.review_text: Yummy  Corner of Union and Columbus, right next to the park.  Good coffee  Good meatball sandwich  Good atmosphere  great way to start a day

WaQ7KcZd3wVozXiDFWIDVA.review_text: Excellent eggplant sandwich.  Also it has that "corner diner" vibe which is cozy.

Qa6s4dYtNA7W9WmnIUn4Fg.review_text: very, very good coffee (graffeo).  i really like this place; it's authentic and no-nonsense.  it's not stupidly expensive like most places in sf.  some of the people who work here will speak italian with you and not make fun of your j.v. language skills.  tosta.

3Yahu7lXBNt9RNjDdBX7Dg.review_text: We popped in here to have a beer whilst we decided what to do for dinner.  It has a really friendly atmosphere, even though the Reggae music was a little loud and not really to my taste.  At the far end of the bar we could see a chap making and stretching the dough for pizzas and cooking them in a small pizza oven.  They smelled pretty good and we were having fun so decided to stay for one.  We had the Italian Meat pizza which was ok.  The owner (or at least the bar man) was very kind and attentive, when my other half was coughing he noticed and brought over a glass of water and after we'd settled up he came over and gave us a half of beer each on the house.  Nice touches that reinforced initial impressions.  Be warned that if you're particular about your Rest Rooms this place only has 1 for everyone and the door is a little rickety, and the basin is in the hallway - but that's kinda in keeping with the relaxed feel of this place.

sIRCHraUB3GREUlIr2A4xQ.review_text: not only do they have an excellent name, these sandwiches rival molinari's (huge, packed with whatever of your heart's delight, and toasted) and its stellar location right on the square is a great place to watch the bums try to con tourists. they also have a short menu of more dinner-oriented items, but i haven't tried them yet.

CePez4M8ww0xqWi10A2B_A.review_text: Coffee and food excellent, service not so much by the guy with the curly mustache...maybe he's pms'ing

1UOTsXkq54pGB5jnFreTdQ.review_text: "We are going WHERE for lunch?  You are making me trek in my heels to go WHERE?  Just b/c guys don't wear heels..." is what ran through my head when a colleague/friend told me where we were going for lunch.  I would have never guessed it by the name and I'm quite sure I have passed it many times before my NB-aware friend introduced me to Mario's.  I had the warm vegetarian sandwich, which was sooo good.  To be honest, I can't recall what my friend had since I was so busy devouring mine.  The reviewers are not kidding about the focaccia.  It is really good.  The focaccia bread is fresh (none of that dry or hard business), with plenty of flavor, and the warmth of the bread embraces the ingredients that sit on top.    Mario's decent price points make it only more desirable.  Yay!  So, why have I not gone back since that first bite?  Heels or not, I regularly remind my friend how glad I am he took me there.  A get-away from FiDi is always refreshing and for such a delicious experience -- well, I better repeat the visit!

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Food here is really good (tried both the chicken and meatball focaccia sandwiches) and service is friendly.  I still have a problem paying $5 for a bottle of Stella but hey, we are in North Beach.  Good spot for a quick bite before a night of drinking (that focaccia bread can really soak up some alcohol!)

eQJtcM6rK0-x2F2UlZaNJg.review_text: Really good service.  That can make up for a lot of mistakes, but there were no mistakes at Mario's and we still got really good service.  Great vibe to the place and a great location for people watching.  Sit down, have a pint, enjoy a great meal and watch things unfold in the park.

u474u_0jbgz93GFHU8lGNA.review_text: Close to work and home I gave it a try today. Ordered a chicken panini to go. As I was waiting I saw these big, delicious, beautiful sandwiches being served so I was really excited to try mine. It didn't take very long to make and I was handed a box. When I got back to work and opened the box I was surprised to see a very small chicken panini. For $10 I thought it was going to be bigger and it didn't look like anything like what was being served. I guess what I saw was the focaccia sandwich. Aside from the size, the chicken panini was absolutely delicious!! I can say that I will return for it and maybe get a salad for a side if I'm really hungry. Service was without a smile but I noticed they are a little nicer to regulars. Taking the good with the bad, I don't doubt I will return...ya, it was that good. =)

JNyLyXn-unUhJmiGJnI6tQ.review_text: I have to admit that I'm not entirely comfortable stopping in by myself at most sit-down restaurants when on American soil.    But I've done just that at Mario's.  Twice.  Maybe I'm at ease dining sola at Mario's because it's so traditionally Italian I think I'm really in Napoli?  Or because it's friendly, and unassuming, and more casual (read: less pushy) than other North Beach trattorias? Whatever the reason behind my newfound homeland confidence, I'm happy to say that the times I have sat at their bar--all by myself--with the newspaper, a panini, and a glass of vino, have been two of my most pleasant and relaxing North Beach memories.

Q2Iest8oggBub6nVBFEcNw.review_text: Mario's worked so well as a coffee break stop on my last walking tour that I decided to promote it to lunch stop this time around.  Which is another way of saying that I was dying to come back and try the much-Yelped focaccia sandwiches (actually, the grilled veggie focaccia is open-faced, meaning it's really more of a pizza, but it's frankly less messy this way, and still crispy-chewy, oiled-to-golden-glory and 100% drool-worthy).

pCGhLbFA8Q2N_LypEOdHcw.review_text: The food didn't thrill me, it was unfortunatly bland and ordinary.  Despite the fact it was almost empty, i was still left waiting for my food for ages.  I know this place has quite a reputation, but i'm not going to come back.

-z3iZnsOuJF08O86oylZfQ.review_text: This place is so charming and quintessential Old North Beach. The staff was very helpful, nice and easy on the eyes on this particular visit. The food is worth the walk from where I work across from SF tourist Hell (Pier 39) On this visit I had the chicken #1 on focaccia & shared a Ceasar Salad with a friend. Delicious!    Again I have to thank Fredda H. for introducing me to this place a couple of years back. We can't figure out for the world why we don't come back here more often. This will definitely be on my top lunch time spots list.

HVgfJPbbFleEsBA2EFpckQ.review_text: I enjoyed my recent trip to the Bohemian Cigar Store this past weekend. The restaurant/bar/cafe is pretty small, but not too claustrophobic, and I found the service to be friendly and attentive. I ordered the oven roasted chicken sandwich #2, with tomato and feta, and thought it was pretty delicious. My only complaint is that for the price I would've appreciate some fries, chips, etc. any side accompaniment, because while the sandwich was good, it didn't completely fill me up. This is a minor complaint though, because I plan to return in the future when I'm in North Beach.

sZLmgGwzupgrdL7pH-BXnQ.review_text: Really good panini sandwiches. I loved the accompanying pepperoncini's. Small, cozy place - very cool.

8CJUQwZWj1Z8SxLMTYZC8Q.review_text: Best Sandwich ever is "The Combo"!  If you order to go, don't let them forget the pepperoncini.  Tear 'em apart and put 'em in the sandwich!  Damn good.    Been hooked for 20 years now!

AnpIbinfzqdoETYZ9XqQ3g.review_text: happened upon this neighborhood mainstay.  got the meatball sammy on focaccia.  it was delicious!!!  get it.  you won't be sorry.

twUwbPXoBpqDDFnPKnXUbQ.review_text: I went here with my Girlfriend the other day. The atmosphere in here is amazing. We were lucky enough to get a table right when we walked in despite it being quite crowded. The waitress that was serving us was a little slow, but at the end of our visit she had totally redeemed herself. I ordered the Combo sandwich, which comes with Swiss Cheese, salami, ham, mustard and mayonaise. She got the sausage sandwich which is served open faced. She also purchased a Salad but that did not arriave. The sandwiches we had were very good. I ordered an Anchor Steam off the tap, and she got a Coffee. The cup seemed a little small and the waitress forgot the cream. When we were getting ready to leave and asked for the check we mentioned the salad never arriaved. Appologizing she gave my girlfriend a free Biscotti and Coffee which made up for the lack of salad. All around our experience was good. Had the service been better it may have been pretty amazing.

MOZNSqLAo8TfhCi5x8iLzg.review_text: We came here because of Graffeo up the  street. They recommended Mario's because this cafe serves Graffeo beans.   We entered from the Columbus side with a  door that is slightly narrower and a door knob that is about the pop off. I get it. It's the cafe thing. Replicating something vintage, European  that sort. I like the the coziness of the cafe. Just a few small  round tables and a bar of course. Friendly staff.   However the cappuccinos that we ordered were a bit subpar. Not the coffee but the milk foam.   Will probably return.

FNxUwpkNMNg8hdJB5guBsg.review_text: I love everything about Mario's. I love the meatball sandwich (and cesar salad), I love the cappuccino, I love the bizarre Balkan pop music, I love the ambience, I love the adorable staff. I *love* the carrot cake. Honey, sweetheart, Mario's, please don't ever change.

wb2I6PxYjRStE7OGLL4S7A.review_text: This is one of my favorite hang out spots in NB. Their sando's are made with love and they use  focaccia bread made down the street which is just awesome. The place is pretty small inside but it's fun to just sit at the bar and have a glass of wine and a delish caprese salad. To be honest their wine isn't anything to write home about hence the 4 stars, but it's reasonably priced and taste's decent.

hdKbGzlTvplL5VM9aQcGjw.review_text: GABRIEL Jer, you have the check out the meatball foccacia. JERRY The fu*k gotcha?  What is that? GABRIEL Foccacia.  Sandwich bread. JERRY Fu** atcha? GABRIEL The meatball sandwich.  It's good.  Bread's thick.  Meat's good.  And they  have two of those spicy things on the side. Jerry looks over and sees a meatball foccacia (my recommendation). JERRY Just how I like my women: crispy on the outside.  meaty on the inside.  spicy on the side. GABRIEL You used that line in another review, dude.

V50vZyOmePiIl7Axe2MWXw.review_text: I liked the way the place felt at first. I was hoping for the whole in the wall quality meal. Well looks can be deceiving.   The food was mediocre and the service was very poor. Our server was so rude and not helpful at all. I do not recommend this place for anyone.

Rx3aRxu4vXJ-v3suVREfmw.review_text: So this is truly a San Francisco classic, the sandwiches are great on Focaccia from Liguria.  Sausage and the breaded eggplant sandwiches are the two best.  Try a house campari, they rock.  The pizza's aren't bad either.  It is a world class cafe.  Prices are reasonable, look to spend about $15 a person.

PDiJYUQZ8QILb23-n8HzGw.review_text: History in the  making, one of the oldest cafes in North Beach.   Unpretentious cafe feel, so you feel welcome right away. Grab a seat at the bar, a table by the window or if it's sunny you may be lucky enough to get a spot outside.   Great vibe, local hangout spot, friendly bar staff.   Great panini sandwiches served on foccaccia bread. I had the tomato mozzarella panini and loved it.   The servers move as fast as they can, but don't expect miracles as this place can get pretty busy.   Portions are a little smaller than I would've expected.   I give 3 stars because I was in a rush and the bar server was taking his sweet time as if I didn't have to rush back to the Fidi.

avTTU8DbBFSP0eqMBZpEKQ.review_text: Got the meatball sandwich and a coke for $14.  This isnt a traditional meatball sandwich, i.e. sandwich roll with three whole meatballs covered  in sauce and cheese.  Rather, it uses a thin, but delicious focaccia bread, which was excellent.  It's not as saucy as your normal sub; the sauce, meatballs (chopped in 1/2)  and the cheese were all well proportioned.  Service was fine.  Ambiance was fine.  If you want a great meatball sandwich, try it out.

_4ZFOXm_AXh88ZT_8YbpmQ.review_text: Wonderful hot focaccia sandwiches.  It's great for take-out for a group - order 3 types of sandwiches, and cut them in fourths, so everyone can have a bite of the many kinds of tastiness - meatball, Italian combo, veggie with cheese.  Their kitchen is also open fairly late so you can go there after seeing a show at Cobb's for a late bite.

HTD7EW4Fmj-s0EKkUUc3Ig.review_text: Oh for the love of sandwiches and everything that is holy in this world!  I went here on a blind date the other night.  While the guy was less than mediocre, the warm eggplant sandwich and baby green salad was amazing.  More please!!!   I generally shy away from eggplant but I am SO happy I chose to go for it this time.  It was perfectly prepared, SO tender and perfectly seasoned.  I don't know what they put on that sandwich but I can tell you it was a mouth full of love and deliciousness.  YUM.  The waitress was great too- actually she had more personality than my date =)  Well worth the time!  I say gitcher butt in there and order the sammich ASAP

cvp4it-nKFW7g2pXzb4eMQ.review_text: Foccacia sandwich!  I remember thinking, "how good could a sandwich be?"  But when I bit into it, a smile and an mmmm emerged.    Saw it on some write ups and was pleasantly surprised.  But haven't returned, not sure if I need to refresh my memory soon...

hGxh6OiANg0E3X3OpChtrw.review_text: I've been coming here since I could walk. It's an awesome place that defines SF food culture.  The actual cafe was a cigar bar many moons ago, not much has changed however now it's a hot sandwich spot  and cafe. I'd advise you to grab a seat at the bar if there is room, but the old school tables next to the windows are not bad either.  Cruise in and grab a hot focaccia sandwich with a few beers (ANCHOR ON DRAFT) and the  small-vintage vino glasses of red wine wine is nostalgic and PROPER. To complete the Mario's experience grab the best piece of tirramisu you'll ever eat along with a cappuccino made with Graffeo coffee roasted locally right up the street.  After visiting this spot you'll be embarrassed of where you eat and drink coffee.

Fg1ZhF_2pHcRwgyq_6yUiQ.review_text: the meatball or eggplant sandwiches more than make up for any shortcomings in the service [stefano acts like an asshole to everbody, i learned to deal with it], even after a long hike over coit tower like on the day i discovered this place  take it to go or have it there, you'll have a view with the park and tel-hi only a few feet away  again, the best meatball and eggplant sandwiches in the city, with lots of great scenery and opportunities to people-watch

ZJ0Z8N3cGu8zEtsy5KeLAw.review_text: Mario's is just about the perfect neighborhood bar and cafe, in my opinion.  The service is thoughtful and friendly in a low-key way, the coffee is from Graffeo across the street, the bread is from Liguria across the park, the "campari" cocktails are $5 and low enough in alcohol that you can linger over a few of them without getting too drunk, the location overlooks Washington Square Park, and the interior is a time-capsule to a time when people had the capacity to enjoy a straight-forward, quality establishment like this for its own sake without deconstructing every perceived slight afterwards on the internet.  If I lived in SF, I would live at Mario's...

oarKDJg3V7mLpgdDVPYmSg.review_text: This place is one of my regular haunts.  I always recommend it to house guests visiting San Francisco.  It's good for morning coffee,  lunch, afternoon espresso, drinks, dinner.  The sandwiches are great - the meatball is the popular favorite - and the pasta is great too.  It's a good place to go with a few friends, and its great to go alone. The service is usually friendly and good, but if you go and they are in a bad mood, don't take it personally- some days are just better than others. It's a place that locals hang out, so you know its good and the prices are right.

XG-JynrbKiiNaqT4ffdI_w.review_text: Fantastic sandwiches, great neighborhood vibe, very friendly staff. I eat here at least once a week.

ixYLMqLBLo4tfcuQ-ewk9g.review_text: Great foccaccia sandwiches, with a good vegetarian option.  Bottles of wine are $21, which is also nice.  Not the best wine in the world, but what do you expect for $21.  They also have house wine for cheaper.  Has a good local feel to it, despite the location.  Sitting outside is great.

Rgxe6btTSPFvVVgLtaLncw.review_text: Grilled eggplant foccacia sandwich. OH.MY.GOD. 'Nuff said.

wCPkiI4PuHrv5dQif6gDvg.review_text: Daang! This place always does me right. I love the vibe that this place brings. Super chill and laid back, if this is not you, then go else ware.  If you appreciate good sandwiches and like to accompany it with a good jammy wine or a cold crisp beer this is your place. They brew up a good cup of joe,so quit reading this and go hit it up.

WDyILww9HxfTwq5zKOGymw.review_text: It turns out that this is my sister's favorite cafe in San Francisco, and she'd been hiding it from me for almost 10 years!  Since she introduced me to Mario's, I find myself drawn back here every time I want to sit with a friend over coffee and dessert or a sandwich without having to deal with the rough, misanthropic crowd over at Cafe Trieste or the overly bright lighting at Mara's.  Mario's feels intimate, definitely Bohemian, maybe a little sexy.  It's your secret hideaway in plain sight.    The cafe mochas here are delicious, rich, not made with cheap chocolate like at so many other places in the area, but something smooth and tasty.  The crunchy focaccia sandwiches are delish, if perhaps a tad pricier than expected for "just a sandwich" (giving me a pepperoncini or two with it doesn't really count in my book, especially since I don't even like them).  There are better sandwiches out there, but these tasty.    But best?  Is the homemade tiramisu.  YUM.  Seriously?  It's the BEST in the city, even *gulp* better than mine (and I make a MEAN tiramisu!!!  Just ask my friends...).  Who would've thought I'd find it here in what is essentially a cross between an Italian coffee shop and Hernando's Hideaway?!!  I think this is a great place for a first date.  Or catching up with an old friend.  It's not well suited to larger groups, because it's actually kind of a tiny place, narrow and a bit cramped, although I HAVE seen folks trying to fit 6-7 people at what is really a four-top.    If you're in a WHEELCHAIR, this place might be a bit too frustrating to try to maneuver around, and I'm not sure how accessible the bathroom is, since I didn't visit on any of the times I was here.  Just writing this review has made me think about going back to Mario's for another round of cafe mocha and tiramisu...mmmm....!!!!

nNoLwBUu45N-YkiTagNVvg.review_text: Really delicious sandwiches. I've had the meatball and the eggplant sandwiches on focaccia and they were both really good. This is a nice, low key neighborhood spot where it's usually easy to get a table.

aMJfDcKDsLkiIJvHnVWy4Q.review_text: The holy grail of meatball sandwiches. A+ for atmosphere as well. Among all the great spots in North Beach, this place is certainly a top five destination.

Tj58A0_D-WsD-UirmpYSEQ.review_text: My first visit to Mario's was in '04 -- a friend of mine and I were overwhelmed by the number of Italian places to try in NB and somehow out of all of them we ended up stumbling upon this gem right smack on the corner of all the action.  This place is a bona fide Italian cafe -- the espresso machine is sputtering non-stop and the waiters are scrambling between taking orders, serving food, and brewing espresso.  The meatball sandwich was amaaaazing.  So fresh and so tasty I'd be hard pressed to find one better.  We also met a local here who was kind enough to show us around NB and said Mario's is the best Italian in all of North Beach - all the other places like Steps of Rome are tourist traps.  We ended up hanging out the rest of the weekend.  Love Marios, and whenever I come back to SF I will be sure to return here!

WNuLe5TyJpL14oV1_R079Q.review_text: Situated near Washington Square Park, Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store Cafe (that's a mouthful) is a great place to lounge around with some good ol' Italian cooking, a meatball sandwich, and a few ice-cold pints. Also a perfect place to people-watch if that's your thing. Mario's has a certain charm about it that you may notice when you step inside. It's relaxed. It's small. Even the service is pretty relaxed. Don't expect chipper, happy-go-lucky waitresses taking your order in harmonious sing-song voices. Rather, the service is no-nonsense, you'll get your shit when it comes.   The meatball sandwich is indeed a delight! Melted mozzarella and meatball with marinara sauce on toasted onion focaccia bread. I love how gooey the cheese is (definitely not a clean eat). The sandwich, among most other things on the menu, are priced reasonably at around 8-15 dollars.   Spend a warm, sunny (you get a few in SF) afternoon here on your next visit to North Beach!

8Ces6YdT6j7BYycnZLrSng.review_text: The place is a rustic looking bar, located in an odd shaped corner, with indoor and outdoor seating overlooking Washington Square park. It's a great local cafe, well suited for lingering while sipping on your cup of cappuccino, latte, or wine (or whatever you like to drink), and enjoying the view of the park and the people that walk by. Despite the name they don't sell cigars here (they just kept the name).  Their menu includes focaccia and panini sandwiches, a few salads, pizza, a few hot dishes (cannelloni, lasagna, eggplant parmigiana, polenta with sausage), coffees and bar drinks (beer, wine, etc.). Surprisingly, they have a lot of vegetarian options in the menu. I like the focaccia sandwiches. They are open-faced, so it's more like getting 2 'mini pizza' (they sell personal pizzas also), with the toppings and melted cheese on top of the delicious+toasted+fluffy focaccia bread (from the famous Liguria bakery). I have tried the chicken #1, meatball with marinara and onions, and the veggie. Sandwiches are $9.75, and the half sandwiches are $5.50. It's a little pricey for sandwiches, but this is an expensive tourist area, so it goes with the territory.  And don't forget to get a slice of cake for dessert ($4). I like their homemade Ricotta Cheese Cake - this is not a "cheesecake", this is a cake that has cheese in it. Let me explain, think of this like a moist cake with a built-in custard in the bottom part. Their chocolate cake is good too.  The place is usually busy, and they use a small oven to make all the sandwiches, so the wait for food could be long (like I said before: good for lingering). If there are no seats available, I recommend that you place the order to go, come back in 10-15 minutes to pick it up, and enjoy a picnic in the park across the street.  ******************* Additional tip: FYI, if you prefer a cheaper sammie instead (not grilled, no focaccia), you could go to Petite Deli (~$6, ciabatta bread, long wait time also) which is only 3 blocks away from Mario's down Columbus Ave, past the WS park (PD closes at 4pm M-F/ 3pm Sat, closed on Sundays). And while you're at PD, maybe get some yummy chocolate truffles next door at XOX Truffles (XOX closes at 6pm).

YAV6s34aS5nm1n9lLt3D7Q.review_text: what can i say?  this place is across from one of the most active parks in one of the most beautiful parts of the city. you are bound to have a good time (especially when sunny) here.  food is good.  small, but just right to get a good feel and service. a lot of gawking can be done inside and out!  beers on tap are good.

ceowV9LSKZEb397yVDqdgA.review_text: I was so excited to try their famous meatball sandwich and then the day my friend and I went, I had had meat lasagna the night before and the meatball sandwich just didn't sound good. So I decided to go with one of their sausage sandwiches. Overall, I think both my friend and I enjoyed our sandwiches (she got the half meatball so it was open-faced), but maybe it's just a preference, this wouldn't top my list of best sandwiches and I'm not hurrying to go back. The panini was really crispy and the sausage was good, but wouldn't be my top pick as far as flavors. I asked for some crushed red pepper and that helped.  Service was good, we went in on a weekday and they were pretty quiet. My friend wanted a diet coke but they only have specialty sodas, he brought her one to taste, but she didn't care for it, it was no problem, they didn't charge us for it. He checked in on us constantly as well.  I'd recommend anyone to try this place, it's definitely a solid sandwich, just wouldn't be the top of my list.

wI4R1BE6wOfsd3_3XoA5_w.review_text: Amazing meatball sandwiches!! Got a table outside by Washington sq park with a view of cloit tower...not too shabby!! And amazingly not rammed full of tourists like some places on Columbus Avx although that may change on weekends...worthy of my 1st yelp review! Had to write something about this place, loved it

e77JyltArqckcdBl13bVbA.review_text: Oversight of the century:  me not reviewing this place.  I've been coming here since the early 90s and it's one of my favorite places in SF.  The woody decor, the wall-full-of-windows, and the view of the cathedral ... fuggetaboutit.  My favorite beers on tap, delicious espresso, and fantastic panini and pizza.  There's pretty much nothing that I don't love about this place.

db6zYDb-ZNuIUxuLaGY07A.review_text: This is a great spot to grab a pannini for supper and a nice Peroni or Moretti to wash it down.  Their coffee isn't bad either.

49tI3YmkP7Gu_tk7X8z60g.review_text: After hearing all the wonderful reviews and being one of the must eats by 7X7 magazine, I was disappointed.  I had their meatball sandwich and it was OK.  I do like how it was on focaccia bread.  But for $10 for an OK sized sandwich and no sides (those peppers do not count especially since I do not like peppers), it was not worth the money.  I do not know how this is only one $ when after tax and tip for only a sandwich it was still $13.  I would rather get 2 5-dollar footlongs at Subway.  At least that will fill me up.

PXJ1YraRcd20kMS3mSOT-Q.review_text: I'm no italian, but I definitely know the difference between your typical tourist trap italian restaurant on Columbus and the real deal meal-ios. These guys are definitely legit. The owner always greets my roommates and I with a smile and a ready, eager hand to cook.  This place has a neighborly feel to it more than any place I've tried in North Beach. Definitely going to recommend it. Oh, and do they actually sell cigars?? Cause I'm not seeing it!
